title: P.10.HC
description: Cultures, traditions and ethnicities of places visited by designer on holiday. Colourful designs are inspired by Morocco with reference to the surrounding historical architecture. Combined both pattern and perspective with illustrative conversional elements to achieve energetic and innovative textile prints.

title: P.10.JJ
description: Surrounded by angular wooden houses, tree landscapes, musical instruments, patterned outfits, natural wooden pattern, carvings and nature, designer inspired from traditional Polish heritage. Beauty and magic of folkloric pattern into the home.
keywords: ["Decorative Folk", "Traditional Polish Heritage", "Modern Interior Collection", "Folkloric Pattern"]

title: P.10.KB
description: The Art Deco movement has provided a big inspiration  in work and is something in which designer are interested in. Printed textile collection is based on metalwork, structures & architecture. The imagery used include roofs of buildings, skyscrapers and tower cranes.
keywords: ["Architecture", "Metal Work Structures", "Art Deco Movement", "Roofs of Building/Skyscrapers", "Tower Cranes", "Geometrics"]

title: P.10.AH
description: Fashion collection inspired by landscapes and aerial views. Designer conveyed the ordered geometry of the English countryside with the wildness of nature. The imagery is taken from observations of the countryside and is translated with a variety of loose marks and controlled drawing styles, with an experimental approach.

title: P.10.RC
description: Patterns from nature have inspired innovative collection of vibrant and energetic designs.

title: P.10.ABRO
description: A collection of quirky and eclectic prints, inspired by 'All things English', from nature to architecture, encompassing people, animals, objects & family history.

title: P.10.AE
description: Based on the theme of urban landscape and derived from a trip to New York, work combines loose painterly marks with graphic imagery mixing vivid accents with dark sultry tones derived from the chaos of the city intended for womenswear A/W 2011.

title: P.10.SJ
description: Work compiles of the relationship between natural organic forms and man-made objects. Creating a somewhat fantasy image as the two are merged, reflecting the ways of the world and the dominance technology has over it. Illustrative drawing will become an all over engineered print for a fashion outcome with explosions of colour.

title: P.10.KC
description: Inspired by the patterns in historic & contemporary architecture, work is a fusion of pattern on pattern, colour on colour. Using a range of materials & processes designs forn an exciting collection for the bespoke interior.

title: P.10.GEM
description: Work takes inspiration from an assortment of geographical, natural and architectural structures combined to create abstract geometrics patterns using various processes of leather manipulation and silk screen printing.

title: P.10.GEL
description: Collection of textile design for women's fashion fabric. The shapes and colours of butterflies, beetles and other insects informed design. The fabric seek to banish the dark, dreary colours the colder months can bring and brighten them up using a dazzling and powerful colour palette.

title: P.10.AP
description: Inspired by the simplicity of symmetrical line found in architecture, interwoven with bold design and palette. Enhanced by surface manipulation through using bonded plastics to create thought provoking structured fashion fabrics.

title: P.10.AR
description: Inspired by the concepts of micro versus macro and the idea of pattern found in natural phenomena, project combines human microscopy with space and astronomy. Designer driven by a personal, cross-disciplinary approach, initially working in the bioengineering department to extract micrographic samples.

title: P.10.CEP
description: Through researching own family history and expressing characters through abstracted objects, designer current collection illustrates individual family members through the form of traditional print practices and a bold fashion outcome.

title: P.10.CP
description: Inspiration lies in the utilisation of the simplest of materials, often second hand, recycled or even thrown away. Designer try to give whatever subject or theme dealing with a new look, perhaps even a new life altogether. Make beauty out of the everyday, the ordinary or even the undesirable.

title: P.10.DQ
description: Exploring leather trends with print using a personal drawing style to create original high-end fashion samples.

title: P.10.JEW
description: In the early 18th century, French Huguenot silk weavers lived and worked in the Spitalfields area of London. Inspiration is drawn from the contrast between the richness of the 'Bizarre' silk designs they produced & the faded interiors that survive today. This collection explores how light falls on and through different materials.
keywords: ["Bizarre Silk v/s Faded Interior", "Spitalfields, London", "18th Century", "Wallpaper", "Surface Designs", "Eclectic"]

title: P.10.JL
description: Delivering luxurious, high-end furnishing fabrics & wallpapers, designed with a dark twist full of mystery & taboo. Obsessive lines & strong colour are paramount in designs along with eclectic imagery & fine detail.

title: P.10.JP
description: An illustrative collection inspired by the notion of irrational feelings, fears and phobias.

title: P.10.JWAL
description: A sophisticated interior collection based on close observations of nature and botanical forms. Through a combination of digital, hand-printed and traditional dyeing techniques.

title: P.10.JWHI
description: An exploration of armour combining organic geometrics with structured pattern to create dramatic designs using intense colour with a strong graphic quality.

title: P.10.KP
description: Based on a forest and its inhabitants, this project combines traditional techniques and cutting edge technology, resulting in innovative surface design outcomes for interiors.

title: P.10.LW
description: The concept behind work is based on the idea of being shipwrecked. Mix linear, illustrative drawings with bold geometrics pattern & bursts of explosive colour, producing one-off hand printed fashion & accessory fabrics.

title: P.10.MW
description: 3-Dimensional forms inspired by geometrics, buildings and structures, exhausting and exploring the technique of origami tessellation.

title: P.10.SSHA
description: Contrasting floral designs printed both by hands & digitally onto a variety of luxury silks. Work has a blend of a traditional floral drawing style mixed with bold marks & vivid colours to create a contemporary twist.

title: P.10.AO
description: Sin creates 'an inclination to' sin. Inspired by the Seven Deadly Sins, work explores imagery from everyday experiences associated with the seven sins: wrath, lust, gluttony, greed, sloth, vanity and envy. Work also explores line and mark marking.

title: P.10.EK
description: Designer northern roots are a defining feature of her personality and have provided the inspiration for this contemporary interiors collection which reflects personal interpretation of life 'up north'. The use of quirky imagery inspired by childhood memories of iconic northern destinations such as Manchester and Blackpool.
keywords: ["Childhood Memories", "Manchester & Blackpool", "Up North-Northern Roots", "Contemporary Interior's Collection", "Lines", "Quirky Imagery"]

title: P.10.DO
description: Abstraction of floral pattern. Experimental textiles.

title: W.10.AS
description: Inspired by buildings & the urban town environment, work explores the use of pattern, colour, line & detail to reflect what is captured in the research drawings. Final project is inspired by the local area, particular buildings in Loughborough.

title: W.10.EB
description: Contemporary architecture in the City, combined with an inquisitive & experimental mind, has inspired a collection of pieces that concentrate on reflection, distortion & structure. An innovative approach with mix of colour, materials & desire to produce samples that can also be sculptural, quirky & edgy.

title: W.10.FS
description: An adventurous & exciting approach to woven interior design, capturing dynamic pattern formats inspired by natural structures, developed with a contemporary edge. Further depth & impact is created by particular attention to yarn qualities & colour palette that is clean, crisp & vibrant.

title: W.10.GW
description: Designer drawn passion & inspiration from organic forms in nature, & have used the luxurious surface of filament silk mixed with wool & monofilament. Open areas of pin stripe with intense, patterned detail move diagonally across the design achieving the sense of movement.

title: W.10.HW
description: With inspiration stemming from the English Spring time, collections of sumptuous, textural, interior fabrics have been created. Compositions of afternoon tea amongst the bluebells, maypole dancing, & fresh country cottage scenes have influenced these textile pieces.
keywords: ["Afternoon tea", "English Spring Time", "Vintage", "Interior Collection", "Cottage Scenes", "Surface Pattern"]

title: W.10.IBD
description: Jelly fish markings & colours have inspired work for final project. The way jelly fish structures appear unsymmetrical on first look; but are in fact very ordered. This has been replicated on weaves by creating tubular forms within the fabric to give a structure & shape that is reflective of jellyfish markings.

title: W.10.JSPE
description: Work is defined by an imaginative, confident use of colour, balance & proportion of objects. It shows a thrilling & vibrant exchange of ideas from the dual perspectives of creating textiles for fashion & interiors. Used an intelligent use of yarn properties & weave structure to accomplish ideas.

title: W.10.KF
description: Inspired by the planets ocean, this collection of hand woven textiles explores the abundant colour & vibrancy of the coral reef paired with the extraordinary vivacity of marine life. The added pleats & tucks in specific areas present a further attribute to the fabrics, enabling a variation of elegant dimensional qualities.

title: W.10.KS
description: Inspired by both architecture & African roots designer have produced an exciting collection of luxury woven fabrics to be used in interiors. Work has become focused on the positioning of lines & space, with an aim to create delicate outcomes, that also give the idea of transparency.

title: W.10.KT
description: A collection excelling innovation & pushing boundaries, whilst positively embracing a sense of commercial awareness. Inspired by the freedom & vibrancy of wildlife resulting in a series of multi-stripes with subtle monochromatic textures.

title: W.10.RB
description: Inspired by vintage stamps combined with travel & architecture, collection focuses on detailed line works creating embroidery within woven designs.

title: W.10.RC
description: Inspired by the film 'The Secret Garden' & ethnic, floral patterns, colours & prints. The structure of woven designs have been developed from looking at the architecture of Eastern cultures. Designer is passionate about colour & theatrical impact.
keywords: ["The Secret Garden", "Eastern Cultures", "Theatrical Impact", "Interior Collection", "Floral Patterns"]

title: W.10.SB
description: Creation of beautiful, inherently desirable rugs.

title: W.10.SP
description: The surface shows multiple techniques: warp-faced ribs, braided-looking cords, herringbone/chevron lines, and small "ladder"� dashes in yellow that sit on top like brocade. The dense weave and repeating motifs create a rhythmic, tactile pattern that feels both geometric and vibrant.

title: W.10.SSTO
description: Work is inspired by vibrant colour palettes, surface textures & compositions found in nature. Paying attention to detail, latest collection is a fusion of intensely dip-dyed yarns, transparent threads & intricate pleating. Created a collection to be admired & touched.

title: W.10.TK
description: Work is inspired by flowers. Collection of woven textile designs has the combinations & contemporary colour palette, exploring different shapes, texture, pleats & curves of the flowers for interior designs. These have been developed from photographic research & captivating vibrant drawings.

title: W.10.EW
description: A stunning collection, inspired by the foxglove, with an intriguing hidden aspect- intricate pattern can be glimpsed beneath protuding cone-shaped structures. One is therefore drawn in to take a closer look, as a bee is drawn into the foxglove flower.

title: W.10.SMJ
description: Inspired by the natural beauty of flowers, a collection of luxurious woven fabrics, combining intricate patterns with rich vibrant colours.

title: W.10.EH
description: Work stemmed from an interest in British heritage leading to the creation of designs inspired by the timeless luxury of Elizabethan textiles. The designs capture the essence of traditional floral patterns incorporating layers of deep, rich colour to create a collection of captivating woven textiles.

title: W.10.HB
description: Inspired by placement in Munich, designer ideas derive from ordinary surroundings; a walk through the English Garden, or the buzz of people surrounding the town glockenspiel in anticipation of something magical.
keywords: ["Glockenspiel Town", "English Garden", "Contemporary", "Interior Collection", "Soft Textures", "Undulating Surface Qualities"]

title: W.10.AF
description: A sophisticated & detailed collection inspired by geometric shape & structure. Woven fabrics are built upon a variety of patterns inspired by ornate & decorative objects. With the aim to contrast the fore & background in order to produce colourful, original & exciting fabrics.

title: W.10.LFEL
description: An eclectic collection of woven fabrics captivating vintage military paraphernalia. Experimentation with laser cutting & mixed media embodies a multitude of research sources, combining them within the fabric.

title: MM.10.ABUG
description: Hard versus soft, shiny versus matt & large versus small; juxtaposition provides constant inspiration. Professional practice focuses on structural contrasts between the geometric urban landscape & flowing natural forms, creating sophisticate, innovative textile. Inspired by traditional & modern techniques.

title: MM.10.AMAC
description: An unconventional cocktail of fabrics, meet couture decadence in tactile shapes, executed through observing explosive forms. A modern twist on the 'Pom pom', translated as sumptuous almost edible delights, which stimulate the senses.

title: MM.10.AMUR
description: Work tends to have many different layers of meaning of which any or all may be apparent depending on the personal perception of the beholder. Current work contains themes of nostalgia, travel & fantasy, & is mainly illustration based.

title: MM.10.CB
description: A humorous take on the British fascination with taxidermy animals.

title: MM.10.CW
description: Body of work seeks to stress a life lived spurring influence from East London & a personal relation typically described as a cheeky, common Londoner. It's about something which is worn in, decrepit & threateningly dilapidated but which holds a modern vivacity, igniting a sense of strength & self worth.

title: MM.10.DM
description: Manipulation of materials combining hand & machine techniques to explore the nature, structure & beauty of what remains of derelict & deteriorating locations. Photography is a strong element in the exploration of the mysterious & ornate detail of the commonly overlooked.

title: MM.10.EE
description: Innovative textile pieces, inspired by scientific images of human cells. Print, embroidery & layering created interpretation of cells inside the human body.

title: MM.10.EK
description: A graphic exploration of anxiety & flux created by the movement of birds, suggested by the use of pattern & embroidery. Traditional methods of felting contrasted with manmade materials culminating in the visual qualities of felt juxtaposed with physicals of manmade.

title: MM.10.ES
description: Inspiration is taken from iconic Modern Architecture & combined with aspects of Historic British Building construction to create versatile pieces based on the idea of manipulated structures. Structural folding & thread designs investigate tensions & graduation of stiff to supple.
keywords: ["Iconic Modern Architecture", "Historic British Building", "Contemporary", "Innovative Collection", "Origami", "Geometrics Shapes"]

title: MM.10.FT
description: Putting Nostalgia in to contemporary context through delicate cut work & illustration.

title: MM.10.HR
description: A collection focusing on traditional indigo denims. Taking inspiration from the sea, pebbles & waves designer have given the classic fabric a modern twist. Experimenting with print processes, distressing & dying gives an individual approach & has transformed denim into a softer textile.

title: MM.10.HT
description: A collection that has pushed the boundaries of material technology by inventing a unique process that permanently bonds rubber fibres onto a variety of fabrics. This led to an array of exciting pieces visually inspired by the theme 'cowboys & Indians'.

title: MM.10.IB
description: Inspiration was originally found in a mouldy pot of houmous & developed to draw from moss, lichen & other type of moulds. Crocheting & combined with knotting processes create a collection exploring intricate attention to detail.

title: MM.10.JA
description: This collection is inspired by architectural structures & transformed into hard & soft, 2D & 3D designs. Laser cutting, folding & the use of mirrored reflections help to manipulate these sophisticated geometric shapes & patterns.

title: MM.10.JCLAR
description: 'Seeing the unnoticed details'. A collection of work that looks at the environment & is inspired by abstracted natural objects, forms & its surfaces. Expressed through jersey fabrics using medias such as stitch, appliqué & fringing to create imagery.

title: MM.10.JCLAX
description: A modern collection that combines structure & delicacy through unusual stitch techniques, inspired by the colours & forms of contemporary architecture within the City of London.

title: MM.10.JM
description: An investigation into the unknown: the belief that there is a delicate line between the natural & the supernatural. Exploring texture, tension & depth to create fleeting microcosms & haunting atmospheres of a seemingly alternate reality.

title: MM.10.JSAV
description: Exposure flirts with the hidden, in a romance between softly sculpted compositions & luscious gatherings of fabric entrusted with delicate detail. Wire is laid bare & fabric is stretched in many directions, as with many relationships, there is tension & delight.

title: MM.10.JSTE
description: Collection focuses on nature's effect on objects both organic & man-made surfaces. As seen in the collection of design, the use of embroidery & stitch techniques appear heavily throughout. The notion of experimenting with stitch & embroidery in order to create unusual & diverse surface textures.

title: MM.10.JT
description: Taken inspiration by observing nature's beauty to create unique 3-D designs, which explore the techniques of origami, pleats & layering.

title: MM.10.KH
description: A unique collection of embellished prints that create a scene of chaos in a fantastical & distorted environment.

title: MM.10.LB
description: A delicate & detailed collection of vintage inspired pieces with a wide exploration of fabric manipulation. Intricate designs created through a variety of laser cutting & embroidery techniques offer a beautiful array of textile conclusions.

title: MM.10.LFAR
description: Inspired by the human body, looking in depth at the skeleton structure & the support we get from it, work has translated into 3D & 2D shapes & forms. The use of vibrant contrasting colours of work has further distanced the original imagery. With a tactile appeal designer aim to have an interactive side.

title: MM.10.LH
description: Study London landscape. Works bears an essence of juvenility & drawing style that was straight forward with complicated simplicity. Medium embraced consists of painting materials with matt paint after masking certain areas with tape. Knitting was mostly used as main medium.

title: MM.10.LI
description: A collection of hand embroidered textiles, inspired by grids & pattern. Using a repetitive pattern leads to a range of interesting & exciting compositions with a wide use of colour. Each piece is individual & random with irregular stitches & hand drawing adds to the home made feel.

title: MM.10.LS
description: This collection of concept fabrics encapsulates the natural aesthetics of coral, by utilising print & a unique method of sculptured quilting developed specifically for this collection.

title: MM.10.MTHO
description: The graphic quality of keys, translated into a contemporary context by the use of various techniques, modern materials & sensitive choice of colours. The outcome is an original & versatile collection which is suitable for both fashion garments & interior spaces.

title: MM.10.MTUR
description: Inspired by an eclectic mix of tribal patterns, geometrics shapes & vintage graphic design, designer created a collection of both 2D & 3D textiles which combine traditional hand made techniques with an innovative application of wood veneer onto fabrics & leather.

title: MM.10.NS
description: Bright yet sophisticated, traditional yet contemporary. Photography & drawing from the basis of a collection which is a collage of contrasting textured materials. Waterproof fabrics combined with cottons to knitted fabrics. Focusing on ordinary objects, transforming them into a conclusion, which is humorously decorative.

title: MM.10.RN
description: Using a selection of machine embroidery techniques & experimentation with aerosol paint, this collection captures the linear & circular patterns created when freezing light in motion.

title: MM.10.RS
description: Designer is fascinated by the structure of corsets & the techniques used to construct them. Enjoy the formation & rigidity the corset boning gives the garment. Corset boning was used to give structure & surface pattern to work, alongside boning, Italian quilting & CAD embroidery was used.

title: MM.10.SSOA
description: Through the use of laser cutting, Italian quilting, embroidery & a number of other techniques, final samples convey the exhilarating & colourful features of life underneath the sea. Textile pieces are produced with some of the finest silk organzas which express delicacy as well as coloured acrylic.

title: MM.10.ST
description: A quirky & vibrant collection unusual textiles & accessories, inspired by the ancient powers of Inca gods & the mysteries of the Orient.
keywords: ["Mysteries of the Orient", "Inca God", "Contemporary", "Unusual Textiles & Accessories", "Quirky", "Geometrics Shapes"]

title: MM.10.SW
description: Studying issues of today's society in collaboration with daily life the modern housewife leads, this collection portrays the affects of life's reality, focusing on developments of technology through to the communication within the home. Twist of 1950's stylised theme.

title: MM.10.TH
description: A contemporary collection of innovative textiles based on urban & industrial environments, working in mixed media, collaborating with metals, plastics & man-made fibres.

title: MM.10.ABEA
description: A vibrant collection inspired by travel, exploring the processes of laser cutting, quilting & embroidery realised through layering & relief.

title: MM.10.EA
description: Dancing with materials to produce innovative & energetic designs, which when combined with layered Perspex push the idea of movement further.

title: MM.11.AA
description: Work with photography & image manipulation. Designer have a fascination with discovering the mixture of textures & colours a photographic image can reveal, & translating these onto fabric. Enjoy using print processes & embrace the unexpected outcomes. Focused on the addition and subtraction of colour.

title: MM.11.AJY
description: These pieces were initially inspired by iron gate patterns & transformed into soft & colourful handmade pieces through development. Showing delicate sewing techniques & original ideas.

title: MM.11.AKC
description: Sculptural & decorative objects, between art, craft & design, are developed through a visual & conceptual design process to create work challenges all preconceptions. Materials, both unusual & common, are entrapped in a variety of media, translating imagery of the microscopic world around us.

title: MM.11.AP
description: Designs are based on circuit boards & components & are focused on the linear design of printed circuit boards, which represent the tracks that pass current. They have been produced on a transparent PVC material, using sewing machine embroidery & design in range of coloured, thin cotton thread.

title: MM.11.AT
description: A fragile collection of 3D & 2D objects, created in knitting & preserved in ceramic, inspired by family, protection, love & warmth. Knitting is burnt away, leaving an abstract image. In life, encounters & events are also immortalised in visual memories.

title: MM.11.BJ
description: Pushing the boundaries with an innovative collection, combining recycled materials with metal, plastic & glass. Resulting in an unusual approach to interior & architectural textile design.

title: MM.11.ED
description: Exploring the theme of movement in relation to birds, the motion of their wings & flight paths. Designer capture movement in textiles by showing single or mass directional movement by using fabric manipulation & laser cutting.

title: MM.11.EW
description: The influences in work relate to Tord Boontje & Rob Ryan. Inspired by nature & geometric shapes, focus is on the texture, shape & composition within the designs. This involves a lot of delicate hand cut work, manipulation & 2D designs combined with 3D suitable for interiors.

title: MM.11.FN
description: Inspired by nature & environmentally awareness, aim to create textiles which reflect timelessness. Colour is vital to designer. Final year work, inspiration came from Rocks & Crystals, & most recently the Universe. Developed silk painting techniques to reveal imagery, & fabric manipulation to translate the structure.

title: MM.11.HLF
description: An appreciation of the beauty that exists in the modest, rustic, imperfect or even decayed, an aesthetic sensibility that finds a new found beauty & elegance in the impermanence of all things organic.

title: MM.11.JHM
description: Exploring the textural surface & the contrast between the fragility & the protective sturdiness of reptilian skin through knit & laser cutting. Using a combination of woollen chunky knit & leather to produce an innovative & dynamic final collection.

title: MM.11.KMS
description: An intricate collection of 3D transformable curiosities & embroidered, etched & embellished fabric samples. Inspired by the similarities found within modern architecture & insect built structures. Combining the fragile qualities of insects nests with harsh geometric shapes within building structures.

title: MM.11.LCRA
description: Delicate tactile pieces with intricate design & embellishment are the primary features of work. Applications include uses for fashion or interior accessories.
keywords: ["Tactile Pieces", "Intricate Design", "Fashion or Interior Accessories", "Geometric Shapes", "Delicacy"]

title: MM.11.LJI
description: Emancipating structured geometric architecture into new forms of 'Organised Chaos'. Creating a physical experience through juxtapositions of contrasting combinations, hard & soft shapes, dull & bright colours, flat prints & raised embroidery, soft knits & crisp polyester cirés.

title: MM.11.MCJC
description: The inspiration of flowers, its delicacy & its volume has inspired a final collection of ruffle designs. The wide exploration of fabrics, pleated versus smooth & hard versus soft; juxtaposition has provided constant inspiration. Intricate designs created by combining different style of ruffles, offered a beautiful array of textile conclusions.

title: MM.11.MH
description: Narrative illustrations that enlighten & humour their audience, developed into three dimensions through material exploration using technological & handcrafted processes to create an experience that fulfils entertainment values.

title: MM.11.NM
description: This sophisticated collection of designs using embroidery, beading & laser cutting embody the intricacies of nature. The graphic quality coupled with the riot of colours gives a contemporary feel. Aim is to bring luxury into every day life.

title: MM.11.PH
description: This collection is inspired by the beauty of the everyday encounter, where a web of invisible threads is woven by the crossings of the crowd & the intersections we form with one another. Unique combination of innovative materials, processes & hand-rendered techniques truly expresses this unappreciated pattern of life.

title: MM.11.SLH
description: Visual perceptions occur when markings interrupt, but a pattern that is complicated to organise, dominates the Mind. Parabolic lines amalgamate to dazzle the Eye; for it is selecting, organising & interpreting the patterns, that distort our sensory stimulations. Mathematical equations & radical designs operate in work.

title: P.11.AM
description: Work shows a collection of prints that have been influenced by geometric structures & this particular collection was inspired by the insides of electrical objects, for a contemporary interior setting.

title: P.11.CJJ
description: Concepts take inspiration from industrial scenes. Designer plan to correlate the paradigms of design, combining textiles & product design theory.
keywords: ["Industrial Scenes", "Texturised Surface", "Modern Art", "Interior Collection", "Geometric Shapes", "Repeated Designs"]

title: P.11.EJ
description: Inspired by the seaside & historic photographs taken around the coast of North Wales. Work showcases an exploration of line & detail to represent movement, including a variety of narrative & pattern based drawings.

title: P.11.GA
description: Strongly inspired by natural phenomena & patterns found within our surroundings, work stylises & abstracts using an opulent palette of colours, creating enchanting designs to reveal another level of beauty from the natural world.

title: P.11.JF
description: Collection is inspired by the nature of organic botanical forms. The use of line & pattern is integral to the design structure to capture & explore a diverse synthesis of texture, composition & colour. The vibrant dynamic visuals form a contemporary collection for use within an opulent interior environment.
keywords: ["Organic Botanical Forms", "Nature", "Contemporary", "Opulent Interior Collection", "Lines & Patterns", "Repeated Designs"]

title: P.11.KH
description: Printing is a tool that has the potential to translate a complicated or simple idea onto a textile with immediate impact. Aim is to constantly strive for this quality through considered use of imagery, colour, pattern & choice of fabric.

title: P.11.LB
description: A bold Autumn/Winter floral inspired collection for women's wear, combined with inspiration from Amsterdam's quirky architecture & character.

title: P.11.LCOL
description: A collection of designs based on combining the views of places visited by designer; capturing peaceful country scenes, picturesque streets & the busy London rush hour, people traveling by car, bike & even by kite; abstracted to form narrative compositions, with use of vibrant colours & surface textures.

title: P.11.LW
description: Creation cannot exist without inspiration & designer is inspired by the world around her. Drawing has always been at the heart of work. Through drawing, exploration of processes & printing, it is that she creates something beautiful.

title: P.11.MM
description: This collection is based on the folds & patterns brought about by compression. The distorted shapes of objects found in scrap yards inspired designs.Interested in the way that different objects could be crushed to produce the same fold lines.

title: P.11.NSP
description: Collection combines modern digital print & traditional screen printing. Travelling allowed designer to find inspiration. Work fuses botanic floral drawing & Taiwanese culture to achieve an imaginative passionate textile print.

title: P.11.OSJ
description: Work is inspired by landscape, animals & natural forms from around designer home in Scotland. Enjoy working with Lino printing, combined with drawing & painting to create interior fabric designs that are fresh, quirky & contemporary.

title: P.11.OW
description: Printed textiles has allowed designer to express styles through drawing, mark making & photography. Using a mixture of vibrant bright colours & sophisticated neutral colours designer developed imagery inspired by Life Underwater.
keywords: ["Life UnderWater", "Exploration of Scale", "Abstract", "Interior Collection", "Lines & Patterns", "Repeated Designs"]

title: P.11.VS
description: A collection inspired by the Exotics of Nature, encompassing the variety of shapes, colours & textures found therein, using saturated colour combinations & hand manipulation techniques. The collection goes on to explore the rich & diverse elements of the natural world, creating luxurious & vibrant designs.

title: W.11.AL
description: A diverse collection of woven textiles that embody enthusiastic & inquisitive approach to weaving & consequently investigate not only structure but also surface quality, pattern, movement & colour. The collection embraces the qualities of wool & elastic to produce 3-D & lively structures.

title: W.11.AW
description: Travels in China inspired these designs, which capture the vibrant colours of the city lights & the sophisticated textures of the modern architecture. Stripes & proportions stimulated from city skylines are contrasted by explorations of translucent surfaces. These visually intense fabrics create a bold statement ideal for luxurious fashion.

title: W.11.EG
description: Work is inspired by travel & the many different cultures around the world. Simplistic yet effective designs focusing on colour & pattern.

title: W.11.FW
description: The grand architecture & opulent interiors of religious buildings, specifically the rich combinations of pattern & colour found on floors, windows & ceilings, inspire a collection of intricate, sophisticated & innovative woven designs.
keywords: ["Grand Architecture", "Religious Buildings", "Contemporary", "Opulent Interior Collection", "Geometric Architecture", "Repeated Designs"]

title: W.11.LS
description: Work is inspired mainly by natural colours & textures. Looking at trees & plants, designer produced a number of vivid & detailed drawings. Enjoy working with thick & textured yarns using the basic twill pattern in weaves & occasionally using metallic thread in the weft.

title: W.11.ML
description: A collection of elusive fabrics inspired by the initial concept of the Eden Project. Experimentations using the simplest combination of designs & materials were explored, focusing mainly on the structural & surface qualities. The interest in geodesic architectural forms also lead to the exploration of 3-D shapes within the samples.

title: W.11.NWH
description: An exciting & imaginative collection of interior textile weaves that capture the colour, texture, pattern & definition of snake & fish skins. Using silk designer have tried to encapsulate the surface & movement qualities associated with these skins.

title: W.11.OB
description: Based on a vibrant exploration of landscapes that are disrupted by roads, rivers & pylons. Making use of an exaggerated palette & dip dyeing technique that reflect designer love of bold colour, texture & pattern to create a contemporary & exciting collection.
keywords: ["Landscapes: Roads, Rivers & Pylons", "Texturised Surface", "Contemporary", "Interior Collection", "Textures & Pattern", "Repeated Stripes"]

title: W.11.SI
description: A bespoke collection of fabrics, driven from the beauty of jewels. Incorporating an exciting fusion of innovative yarns such as wires, beads & ribbons, this collection is intended for the elaborate & richly decorated rooms, where the fabrics can catch the glisten of light.

title: MM.12.AP
description: Work is jewellery & accessory design base where material experimentation in the form of metal, glass & wood has been integral. The style of work is highlighted by the combination of textures, use of colour & flamboyant design aesthetics.

title: MM.12.ES
description: Tokyo underground stations sparked a interest in infinite tunnels & the disorientation experienced during the commute, provoking a tactile response of colliding angles in thread & mirrored acrylic.

title: MM.12.GF
description: Intrigued by the convergence of fragility with rigidity, concept explores skeletal structures & their purpose as a supportive framework for the more unstable fabrics of the body. This has translated into hand-crafted structured platforms that both control & manipulate the fabricated surface, creating fluid sculptural formations.

title: MM.12.JE
description: Exploring the changing form & shape of a snake after the feeding process, through the use of hand & machine knit. Using a combination of metallic threads, wire, & beading techniques to produce sustainable, tactile surfaces, which once applied to the body can create sculptural 3D accessories.

title: MM.12.JG
description: A personal collection exploring the emotion behind designer memories through photographs. Playing with colour & texture is essential to work as it portrays the emotional presence. Fabrics combine dyeing, digital printing & various forms of hand & machine embroidery to create intricate, quirky textiles for fashion application.

title: MM.12.JP
description: Up Above & Down Below: A collection of 2D pieces portraying a battle between fluid & geometric pattern, repetition & hard versus soft surfaces, bringing the floor & ceiling to eye level. Using laser cutting, etching, eyeleting, & riveting on suede & silk, designs are aimed towards fashion.

title: MM.12.KW
description: Work revolves around the notion of time, & how it affects the natural world. Aim to explore how a material or object can transform over a period of time, be it through growth or decay. Designer then utilised these transformations to create textile art pieces.

title: MM.12.LCAM
description: Inspired by medicinal flora & fauna, this collection aims to explore the rich & diverse elements of the natural world whilst embracing the intricacies of nature. Experimental media allows modest infusions of colour to breath through the piece transforming dark organic tension attempting to connect.

title: MM.12.LCRA
description: Inspired by organic repetition & contrast; the way nature repeats patterns, structures & textures at different scales. Created new surfaces from scratch, developing layered, dimensional pieces that resonate with natural growth patterns.

title: MM.12.LH
description: Conurbations & metropolises- strange urban land's of geometric heights, petrified desert of grids & lattices, developing, transforming & expanding as populations swell. New towns emerge overnight, bringing new, diverse & exciting architecture. Towns engulfed by cities, villages engulfed by towns. Flourishing & thriving.

title: MM.12.RN
description: Through the use of hand embroidery, fabric manipulation & surface embellishment, designer created a luxurious collection of glamorous samples, inspired by rocks & minerals.

title: MM.12.SD
description: Working towards a natural & sustainable project in light of eco-friendliness. Final project is inspired by repetition in nature & will be projected in final piece as a 3-D sculpture. Natural materials & organic lines are vital for project.

title: MM.12.SHEB
description: A tactile collection exploring the coral reef & its inhabitants. Three dimensional pieces combine both traditional & non-traditional materials to create a superstructure, exploring the diversity & behaviour of the underwater world. This is reinforced through the variety of scale & the contrasting of interactional material textures.

title: MM.12.SHUR
description: Inspired by the chrysalises of butterflies & their armour-like qualities, this is an unconventional collection for fashion using an intriguing combination of materials. Metal, leathers & silks are printed, laser cut & embellished forming protective cocoons for the body.

title: MM.12.EW
description: By exploring the potential of stacking, repeating & joining 'ready-made' multiples, designer created a collection of tactile textiles samples which push the boundaries between fashion & textiles art.

title: MM.12.ZQ
description: Garments are brought to life through dynamic patterns & shapes. Using thermochromic pigments & shape memory alloy wires, fabric pieces emphasise parts of the body through illusionary designs, with changing lines & forms inspired by architectural themes.

title: MM.12.SY
description: Work explores the textural surface and uniqueness of our feet & skin. It showcases an exploration of line & detail to detract the viewer from the obvious image. Worked with lino printing combined with hand stitch & also experiment with materials such as latex & leather, which gives work a tactile nature.

title: P.12.ADO
description: Between the Lines', inspired by intersecting lines and the complex geometric forms they construct. Referencing modern architecture, this print collection for interiors explores dramatic shape together with a muted, sophisticated colour palette.

title: P.12.AE
description: An exploration of the relationship between natural life forms & geometry. The imagery produced combines these two conflicting components which, through an enthusiasm for illustration, forms a contemporary interior collection.

title: P.12.AW
description: Inspired by the beauty of wild British floral & organic forms with an emphasis on fine detailed line drawings to create stylised contemporary prints intended for interior wallpapers & unique upholstered items. The use of vibrant contrasting & harmonising colours brings a sense of luxury to interior.

title: P.12.BBF
description: An eclectic feminine Spring/Summer fashion collection. Imagery inspired by Columbia Road Flower Market. Work evokes an ambience of summer romance & feminine chic. London based fashion print designer with a strong interest in colour, photography & styling.

title: P.12.BG
description: Insects have always been an exquisite source of inspiration for designer. Looking at the contrast in colour, shape, delicacy & fascinating symbolism that surrounds them has influenced designer to create an eclectic set of bespoke items for those who want to challenge the perception of home interiors.'

title: P.12.BW
description: A Spring/Summer fashion collection inspired by the study of entomology, created using detailed drawings & vivid colours to convey the hidden beauty found within insects. The collection captures insects both figuratively & as close up compositions that take on an abstract form.

title: P.12.CBOR
description: Designs evolve from narrative themes, exploring imagery as seen through drawing, observational drawing, sculpture & imagination. Aspire to create printed fabric designs that provoke intrigue & curiosity, in both the aesthetics & physicality.

title: P.12.CBOW
description: Free flowing lines & shapes have been a prominent feature in previous projects which designer engineered towards the high fashion market.Urged designer to tackle a more rustic approach for finaal major project. Focusing on imagery taken from scrap heaps, envisaged designs within the interior industry.

title: P.12.CM
description: A vibrant collection inspired by the diverse natural forms & elements within the underwater & sea life world. The collection explores the rich colour & pattern to create luxurious, exotic designs. Using both digital & screen printing processes to translate & form an interior collection.

title: P.12.CR
description: Inspired by garden flowers, vintage & antique objects. They have been combined together by setting up still-life compositions, which are then designed into motifs & patterns. The collection includes wallpaper & upholstery fabrics in a pastel colour palette.

title: P.12.CS
description: Idea is based upon architecture, using the buildings patterns to create tribal & geometric prints, which are for contemporary fashion. Used monochrome colour palette with splashes of colour to add another dimension to the collection.

title: P.12.CSW
description: Strongly influenced by nature's own pattern & texture, the combination of detailed drawing & a contemporary colour palette offers designs intended for a commercial interior application. By experimenting with new materials & occasionally manipulating material surface, a sense of depth & detail intended.

title: P.12.CWHA
description: Work was inspired by visit in Marrakech. Developed different processes such as engineered pleats & laser cuts within prints. Used a variety of different printing techniques & CAD skills. Prints have been designed for Spring/Summer high-end fashion.

title: P.12.CWIL
description: Inspired by seaside locations along North Coast of Cornwall, this swimwear fashion collection strongly reflects designer passion for sportswear design. Narrative compositions are created in delicate & feminine pastel shades to portray the picturesque Cornish scenes & provide an innovative take on sportswear.

title: P.12.DG
description: "Some people look for a beautiful place. Others make a place beautiful" Hayat Inayat Khan

title: P.12.ECAR
description: Emotional Manifestation' Inspired by the natural world, the eccentric nature of wild animals is encompassed within their unusual facial expressions. The detailed characteristics are transposed onto a multitude of textured surfaces in an effort to bring both aesthetics & touch to life, within vibrant fashion designs.

title: P.12.ECLA
description: Often taking inspiration from architectural elements, led designer to spend time drawing in a linear expression. Explored a natural structure, which allows designs to further explore the use of line & texture in a more challenging way.

title: P.12.GG
description: Employing strong mark making skills, exploration of perspectives & a narrative feel, designs are intended for a modern interior purpose. Using a traditional yet individual colour palette, work explores perspective & texture in order to produce a story behind designs.

title: P.12.HM
description: Focused on the emotional link between flowers & the feelings they evoke, translating this through screen printing & digital design. Optimising strong shapes by accentuating colour & original line drawings, produced an edgy fashion collection giving a visual representation of title "Who said romance is dead?"

title: P.12.JI
description: The Urban Fabric of Life' represents a collection of designs that are based on urban living in central London. Re-created a range of textures found within our surroundings & combined them with typography to achieve detailed narrative compositions, using a vibrant colour palette & surface manipulation.

title: P.12.JM
description: Inspired by paper & fabric manipulation this vibrant collection uses photography & observational drawing to challenge the eye. Combining digital & screen printing techniques gives the designs a dynamic effect.

title: P.12.KA
description: Sometimes inspiration is found at home. Designer Dad's shed isn't just any shed. It's three massive sheds filled with super old computers & vintage electronics. And mum's garden is still one of the most beautiful with irises, tulips, poppies & roses, fat pigeons & sneaky foxes.

title: P.12.LH
description: Inspired by nature work captures the colour & texture of insects, their patterns & their surroundings. Designer loves for mark making & using different media has enabled her to create a bold & exciting interior collection.

title: P.12.MG
description: Through exploration of line, colour, & composition, designer produced a high-end fashion collection inspired by florals & other natural forms. A combination of hand-rendered & digital print processes has enabled an exciting collection for Spring/Summer rich with colour & context.

title: P.12.PB
description: Work is strongly inspired by animals, nature & natural forms. Drawing is designer true passion & is at the heart of all designs. Produced detailed, colourful prints for fashion or interiors & believe that colour is an important factor that can bring any image alive with emotion.

title: P.12.RG
description: By combining man-made & organic forms, designer created imagery. Inspired from nature, plants & flowers in particular, creating designs using both blocky & linear imagery to achieve different depths within work.

title: P.12.SB
description: The House of a Hoarder' is a collection of interior printed textiles celebrating eccentricity through eclectic & illustrative imagery. The use of leathers & luxurious fabrics as well as ceramics, combines a mixture of processes & techniques leading to a highly creative & personal project.

title: P.12.SJ
description: A collection of designs inspired by the structure of chaos: focusing on the juxtaposition of continuous movement & static architecture within New York. Combining stylised drawing techniques, a contemporary colour palette & surface manipulation to create a collection that can be applied to fashion & interior.

title: P.12.VP
description: "Fetish florals” A contemporary spring summer fashion collection, inspired by exotic botanical forms & the textures found within them. Using a vibrant colour palette, combining the processes of screen & digital printing; alongside the exploration of surfaces such as PVC.

title: W.12.AM
description: Work is strongly inspired by butterfly, bird structure & colouring. This theme has been chosen because of the beautiful details & hues of these creatures, which is something designer wish to emulate & reflect in the woven pieces.

title: W.12.AMC
description: Derived from colour changing reptiles, this exploratory collection of woven fabrics display complimentary colours, continuous pattern & extraordinary surface qualities fit for the male fashion industry.

title: W.12.AP
description: A collection of textural weaves sit alongside laser etched designs inspired by electrical overheads & architectural shapes, focusing on the qualities & movement of yarn. The use of a monochrome colour palette with metallic accents creates a distinctive & exciting collection designed for fashion.

title: W.12.CC
description: Inspired by familiar ornaments & decorations around the home, designer have captured colours & patterns from these groups of quirky objects & translated them into an exciting & sophisticated collection of woven fabrics for interiors.

title: W.12.CH
description: Taking inspiration from the structure of butterflies & the vibrant colours of flowers, designer have created a bespoke collection of weaves for interiors. A variety of silks & wool, which have been hand dyed, capture the texture & patterns of a butterfly's wing.

title: W.12.CHOA
description: An exclusive collection of woven textiles, inspired by the natural occurring organisms & pattern of fungi. Incorporating a variety of different elastics & cotton yarns to produce 3-Dimensional, textured fabrics; intended for contemporary, fashion garments.

title: W.12.CJJ
description: The eroding industrial architecture of the pottery industry in Stroke-On-Trent has inspired designer to create a range of woven fabrics designed for luxurious furnishings. From photographs of the area, used colour, texture & pattern to demonstrate an interesting, alternative collection, experimenting with layers, weights & structures.

title: W.12.DJ
description: The juxtaposition of organic & man-made structures found within the markets of East & South London has been the focal point that has informed this collection. The combination of contrasting colours, textures & structures has created a unique & vibrant collection of menswear fabrics.
keywords: ["Man Made Structures", "East & South London", "Contemporary", "Menswear", "Repeated Motifs", "Abstract Form"]

title: W.12.EB
description: The range in colour & intrinsic details found in underwater life inspires this distinctive collection. Exploring intense hues, intricate structures & subtle surface textures, these dip dyed silk pieces are intended for high end fashion.

title: W.12.EH
description: Inspired by Venice, this simple yet energetic collection has been motivated by the city's beautiful canals, architecture & life. Colour plays a huge part within work, as well as line & composition.

title: W.12.ELH
description: An exciting collection of woven silk fabrics for fashion, inspired by Kew Gardens & The Brighton Pavilion. Their bright & vivid colours contrast with black & white stripes creating a range of vibrant & innovative woven piece.
keywords: ["Kew Gardens & Brighton Pavilion", "Contemporary", "Fashion Collection", "Repeated Motifs", "Organic Forms"]

title: W.12.ES
description: This collection takes woven fabrics into 3-D wall structures for interiors. Used silk, polyester & wires, looked at the shadowing qualities of the materials, simple twills & distortions. Concentrated on colour transitions from deep purples through to shades of orange, reflecting movement of colour found within fish scales.

title: W.12.HB
description: The modern architecture of Sydney & London has inspired lively, graphic designs. Focusing on the relationship between colours & pattern as well as geometric juxtaposition, designer created an energetic collection of fabrics for contemporary interiors.

title: W.12.HLW
description: Inspired by tropical birds & surroundings, colour & structure is key to collection. Produced a playful range of woven designs intended for fashion. Designs express love & passion for vibrant colour alongside careful consideration to structure while creating bird shaped patterns.

title: W.12.JB
description: A diverse collection of woven textiles for interiors inspired by the machinery of a functioning silk weaving mill. The collection embodies my passion for colour & texture & is centred around the idea of luxury. The fabrics embrace traditional design values but with a contemporary twist.

title: W.12.JC
description: Drawing inspiration from a range of beautiful antique keepsakes, designer combined fascination with quirky, forgotten aspects of our past with contemporary design. Using soft colours, delicate pattern & surface detail, the collection evokes a sense of luxury & pure beauty.

title: W.12.KG
description: Exotic flowers & plants housed at Kew Gardens are the inspiration behind my collection intended for interiors. The natural shapes found are translated into a collection that explores exciting compositions, interesting surface qualities & vibrant colour.

title: W.12.KH
description: An original collection of fabrics inspired by fishing nets. Incorporating a mixture of fishing line & strings alongside other thick yarns to create texture, this collection is intended for high-end interiors & would look great on carpets held within an environment inspired by the original inspirations.

title: W.12.LD
description: A sophisticated collection of woven designs inspired by the huge variety of shapes found on architecture when closely inspected. The combination of detailed pattern, dynamic colour & line has been explored, to create eye catching & intricate large & small pieces. These fabrics are perfect for contemporary interior use.

title: IDP.25.FH
description: Connections,  is an interiors collection designed for a nature-based mobile social prescription hub, that promotes and prescribes group outdoor activities. It aims to help individuals build connections with others and the natural environment. Rooted in the NHS"�s holistic and personalised healthcare model, known as social prescribing, the scheme supports those facing everyday stresses and anxieties.

title: IDP.25.GA
description: Suffocating the Sea, is a collection intended to raise awareness and educate about the damages that oil spill causes to the ocean. Influenced by the colours created in the aftermath of an oil spill and the darkness of crude oil, this collection explores how the booming oil industry has sinister side effects in order to provide the world with energy.

title: IDP.25.JL
description: Threaded Echoes: Sound, Memory and Fabric, is a multi-sensory textile design project that explores the emotional weight of homesickness. It aims to recreate the comforting presence of "�home"� through tactile, visual, and auditory elements, offering emotional grounding in transient urban living environments.

title: IDP.25.JRAN
description: Travelling Tranquillity, project explores textile design for a futuristic autonomous vehicle imagined for the year 2050. Combining colour, form and e-textiles, the collection creates immersive environments that support wellbeing, productivity and relaxation. Inspired by flexible rental models and future urban visions, these vehicles offer on-demand, door-to-door travel while reducing congestion and carbon emissions.

title: IDP.25.LA
description: Familiar Spaces, is a project centred on creating personalised fabrics that remind you of family by exploring traditions and gatherings as key memory triggers. Drawing from own experiences, the project is based on designer family home in Spain and the memories associated with it.

title: IDP.25.SP
description: Wonderful, Wonderful, Wonderland: is a luxury, maximalist, imaginative textile collection for the home space. It is inspired by the themes of fantasy and imagination, exploring the uniqueness of storytelling and illustration. This collection reflects upon designer joyful experience of Tivoli Gardens, Copenhagen, an amusement park which invites people to escape every day life.

title: IDP.25.SR
description: My Dopamine,  is a textile-based project inspired by designer childhood memories of gardening and flower arranging with her grannies. Influenced by figures like Constance Spry and contemporary design trends, the collection celebrates colour, memory and customisation, offering a playful, sustainable alternative to traditional vases that invites emotional connection and creative interaction.

title: MM.25.BS
description: Ordinary Becomes Precious: Collection explores wealth inequality in the UK, highlighting the fact that some people are extremely wealthy, and some are less fortunate, as they are affected by the ongoing cost of living crisis.

title: MM.25.CC
description: Out of sight: project delves into the issue of bottom trawling, and the destruction of the world's biggest eco-system, the ocean. Exploring how multi-media design skills can transfer into designing and enhancing systems for ocean protection and restoration.

title: MM.25.DJ
description: Days at 262: Collection is inspired by designer family's beach hut which has been passed down through the family for over 50 years. Every visit down the beach hut thrives with memories, each familiar sight full of colours and texture, filled with nostalgia embracing the togetherness and joy.

title: MM.25.EB
description: Gosh, Haven't You Grown, collection depicts a hypothetical future of fashion in the year 2040. A new culture of fashion consumption takes inspiration from the World War Two campaign of Make Do and Mend. Demonstrates how to make children's clothing last as long as possible through mending, adjustability and emotional durability.

title: MM.25.EH
description: Hidden in Plain Sight: Project is grounded in the true story based in Germany of thousands of books from the Bavarian State Library that were hidden in the chapel of Schloss Haimhausen during World War II to protect them from destruction. Project responds to that reality by highlighting the enduring tension between knowledge and control.

title: MM.25.EW
description: Faithful Fabrics: Garments as Keepers of Memory, experimented with methods of cyclical deconstruction and repair to highlight the beauty of aged and slow fashion. Inspired by photography of wrinkled scarred skin, tattoos and piercings.

title: MM.25.JREY
description: The Soul of Jazz, is a multi-media installation that celebrates the raw, emotional energy of live jazz- and the spaces that make it possible. In a time where music is increasingly being streamed and experienced passively. Designer wanted to create something that reminds people how the music feels.

title: MM.25.KB
description: Safe Haven. Project focuses on restoring a neglected coastal landmark in the town of Tyne mouth, in the North East. Work is inspired by natural forms with an emphasis on sustainable practices, using natural dyes and material for interior application.

title: MM.25.KW
description: Isère: Project focuses on exploration and exercise within the alpine region of Isère through the exploration of the sensory processes and energies experienced through the physical to metaphysical.

title: MM.25.LK
description: Persephone: Goddess of Growth. Work focuses on social themes such as perception and identity. Project explores how the perception of beauty effects the power dynamics between men and women. The concept is investigated at the intersection of myth and film through the story of Persephone, Greek mythology.

title: MM.25.MH
description: Beyond the light is inspired by the phenomenon of light, shadow and the powerful impact of natural light on human experience of space, well-being and our relationship with the environment. Informed by historical, scientific, and artist research, the project examines how light not only shapes space and perception but also influences emotional and physical health.

title: MM.25.ML
description: Reflection of Her: is a body adornment collection that celebrates the female form and the ever-evolving relationship women have with their bodies. Challenging the male-gaze, it reimagines fashion as an enhancer, not a shield, and is inspired by the beach, a place where designer feel most recharged and connected.

title: MM.25.MM
description: Project focus is pollution in rivers and how it is more often than not ignored, unpublicised and hushed up to allow corporations such as sewage treatment plants to run with more ease and less cost. Project concept is a collaboration with an activewear brand as this targets the sports people who use the river but also those that don't, and therefore provides publicity to the issue through being a collaboration.

title: MM.25.NC
description: Mexico on the Move: Inspiration comes from designer Mexican heritage. Explored the rich symbols, patterns and colours of Mexico, with a particular focus on symbols that have been adopted, adapted or appropriated by other cultures and the fashion industry. Project aims to open up conversations around cultural appreciation versus appropriation.

title: MM.25.OC
description: Collection is primarily inspired by family surname Chmura: Clouds. Collection aims to capture the beauty of the landscape, as it ever changing, not only due to climate change but also due to political influences. Focused on the Bieszczady Mountains where designer family comes from and have childhood memories.

title: MM.25.SMOS
description: Worn with Time: explores the mourning of childhood and the bittersweet pull of nostalgia. Drawing on personal memorabilia from herself 'the designer', her mum and nan, she has created a fashion collection that celebrates sentimental value.

title: MM.25.TC
description: Coastline Collective, is comprised of a series of multi piece game sets that encapsulate bold tonal colour in combination with varied material surfaces and technical processes. Designer passion for creating adaptable, versatile pieces that repurpose materials and reimagine our connection with textiles to bring communities together.

title: MM.25.YC
description: Sensory Playground is a multi-sensory textile project designed for neurodivergent children, particularly those with autism. Work explores how touch, colour, and structure can support sensory regulation thus creating aa sensory-friendly textile interior space.

title: P.25.BN
description: Tree of Life, the purpose of this project was to highlight the importance of having a connection with our environment, supposing that if people maintained a good relationship with the environment that they would look after it better.

title: P.25.ES
description: Beyond the Book, is a vibrant and interactive interior collection designed to ignite love for reading in young children. Inspired by the charm of home county, Norfolk, designer collection comes to life through the captivating self-written story journey.

title: P.25.JC
description: Pathways: Inspired by three coastal locations that are meaningful to designer, Pathway is an interior print collection that harmonises together three very different coastal locations through design, using colour, motifs and pattern, created to celebrate the 2025 completion of the English Coastal Path.

title: P.25.LT
description: Milestones, designer aimed to capture the wonder of childhood by following and exploring his little boy developmental milestones, from his first day as a new-born to the moment he stood on his own. Taking inspiration from his physical and cognitive growth, this project weaves together movement, form, colour, and pattern in order to create a visual narrative that celebrates and is inspired by each transformative stage.

title: P.25.SMAR
description: Not Without Thorns: Project celebrates dance as a sport, challenging stereotypes and highlighting the rigorous training dancers undergo. Designer wanted to celebrate a recognise what it's like to be a professional dancer.

title: W.25.AT
description: Fragile Depths, is a personal exploration of our relationship with the ocean, its beauty, its vulnerability, and the impact we have on its ecosystems. The project began with a simple fascination: collecting and photographing seashells, drawn in by their subtle hues and intricate textures. But what started as an aesthetic investigation quickly deepened into a broader inquiry into marine life, scale, and environmental connection.

title: W.25.EC
description: Legacy, project explores the concept of legacy, examining how individuals are remembered throughout history and how certain lives can capture the imaginations of future generations. Designer focus is on the enduring legacy of the Mitford sisters with an emphasis on the interwar period.

title: W.25.EN
description: Distorting the Calm, project explores the sensory experience of overstimulation from the perspective of neurodivergent individuals. Designer explore colour, texture, movement, and projection to provide an empathetic and understanding installation.

title: W.25.HV
description: Flooded Rutland, A Woven Warning, project highlights the local implications of climate change related flooding in designer home county of Rutland, focusing both on educating the public about the damage and disruption, and providing possible solutions through data abstractions and impactful imagery in textile form.

title: W.25.IS
description: Carrying Passementerie, project reimagines the endangered craft of passementerie, a woven technique for creating ornate decorative trim, by exploring its potential within contemporary accessory design. Through playful experimentation with scale, the incorporation of utilitarian metals like washers, and vibrant colour, my work challenges conventional notions of passementerie and repositions it in a modern context.

title: W.25.JB
description: Calm in Transit, project explores how woven textiles can reduce light anxiety and sensory discomfort, transforming the modern aircraft cabin into a more calming, human-centred space. Collection addresses common stressors such as claustrophobia, motion sickness, and sensory overload through carefully considered design choices.

title: W.25.LGAS
description: The Ephemeral Bride, is an exploration into compostable bridal wear. The textiles embedded with seeds and assembled into biodegradable garments that can be buried after the wedding ceremony, eventually transforming into plants of the wearers choice.

title: W.25.LGLO
description: Woven Routes, Threads of Time, project examines historical textile fragments from the Silk Road, revealing natural dyes, sustainable fibres, and thoughtful textile techniques as traditions that continue to resonate with contemporary design and illustrate how ancient knowledge can guide sustainable futures.

title: W.25.MN
description: Diasporic Thread, designer inspired by her grandparent"�s story of migrating from Jamaica to Britain and the historical narratives of movement within the wider Caribbean community, "�Diasporic threads"� encapsulates the dualities and complexities of migration, and the role it plays in the erasure of cultural heritage within the Afro/ Caribbean diaspora.

title: W.25.MR
description: Earth threads, the Living Thread, project is centred around the exploration of mycelium, which is a root-like fungus that has been grown from barleycorn. Through extensive experimentation, and many petri dishes later, designer have managed to grow a sustainable and biodegradable material that I have knitted and bonded throughout my project process.

title: W.25.MV
description: Material Rehabilitation, project consciously designs with bioplastics, aiming to better improve the receptiveness of bioplastics beyond a novelty and to start the conversation around conscious design. Stop and think about how you want your materials to behave?

title: W.25.RDS
description: Leaving Tracks, project looks at creating textiles for a hypothetical space where athletes and ex-athletes can go to talk about their sport needs after leaving their sport due to retirement or injury. Designer believe it is important therefore to bring awareness to the support needs that athletes, amateur, hobbyist or professional, may have once retiring from their sport.

title: W.25.RT
description: Les Deux Soeurs,  is an intergenerational woven fashion collection inspired by designer family"�s farmhouse in the South of France. This home has represented stability, consistency, and connection for me; a place where generations gather, share stories, and create lasting memories. Rooted in heritage and emotion, the collection explores how textiles can hold and express these values.

title: IDP.24.AROB
description: A project exploring reality dipping into themes of quantum physics, astro-projection, black holes & time relativity. A walk through Loughborough, imagined a parallel universe where things remains the same yet life is different & things are jumbled slightly out of place.

title: IDP.24.EA
description: Explores the possibilities of biomaterials in fashion, a concept designer believe has great potential for the future of textiles. The outcome of this collection is just a stepping stone to reducing the huge environmental impact fast fashion has on the world, especially in the festival & rave wear sector.
keywords: ["Green Beat", "Biomaterials", "Sustainability", "Fast Fashion Rave & Festival Wear", "Climate Change", "Geometrics"]

title: IDP.24.EJD
description: Hiking has always been a major part of designer life thought she dislike it. The idea of rebelling, & material questioning has been realised in the concept of this collection. Materials used for this collection will naturally biodegrade at some point in the future.

title: IDP.24.HO
description: Project evolved from designer heritage growing up in Cornwall & studying in Sydney led her to take up regular sea swimming. Cold swimming is proven to deliver many physical & mental health benefits. Collection is a reflection of the need to find balance in our lives, & appreciate life for what we have.

title: IDP.24.KG
description: Inspired by the lives of designer's grandparents who lived in Hong Kong. This collection nods to that time through highlighting key information from strict government documents which contrasts with the post-war freedom of life in the luscious countryside. Clean designs, conscious colour to keep it sophisticated & minimalist.

title: IDP.24.MB
description: Focuses to reset the circadian rhythm that has been challenged with the increase of light pollution emerging in urban city culture & lifestyle. The work is developed to see how textiles can reset the circadian rhythm with how colour & materials can co-operate with natural lighting to optimise bringing the natural outdoors more to people's attention & needs.

title: IDP.24.PSTA
description: To create a collection of indoor hanging canopies with accompanying cushion designs for adults to experience ultimate comfort & sanctuary within. Inspired by a different studio Ghibli movie from which designer found comfirt as a child. Another inspiration the everyday items & rendom things came across whilst exploring the city of London.
keywords: ["Hanging Sanctuaries", "Ghibli Movie & City of London", "Abstract", "Interior, Deco", "Lines", "Organic Forms"]

title: IDP.24.SE
description: Project draws inspiration from designer upbringing in Wales. It interweaves traditional Welsh craft with personal memories of growing up in Wales. In her grandparent's house in South Wales, Welsh was the primary language spoken day to day & much of the visual imagery takes inspiration from artefacts within the house including wool blankets, the family dresser, ceramics.

title: MM.24.AG
description: Inspired by childhood travels around the North Island of New Zealand, project explores the hidden wonders of Taupo's volcanic zone. Collection investigates the chemical nature of these landscapes & translates them through textile materials & processes. Different materials have been manipulated by high temperatures, creating a variety of ssurface designs.
keywords: ["NEO", "North Island of New Zealand", "Conceptualism", "Sportswear & Streetwear", "Climate Change", "Abstracted Forms"]

title: MM.24.AM
description: This project is inspired by designer love of Forest School Camps(FSC), a charity that takes children across the British countryside & promotes radical education & learning by doing. It aims to create a sense of responsibility for each other within a community close to nature. Used quilting, which is rooted in traditions of community, protest, & reuse.

title: MM.24.AS
description: Collection explores the concept of aging not only the physical themes but also the mental, focusing on the texture, complexion & importance of our largest organ, skin. Aims to present the beauty within the aging process even with all its complexities. Designer challenge the preconceptions around aging & present a deeper understanding of empathy.

title: MM.24.AV
description: This project explores post-war social housing, specifically focusing on tower blocks & council estates located in East London. Perception is vital when defining a home, with lived experiences, comfort, relatability, & familiarity all possessing the ability to shape one's outlook on a home. This collection celebrates materials in their most raw & natural form.

title: MM.24.AW
description: Collection tells the story of Staffordshire's delicate craftsmanship & industrial history. Aims to be thought-provoking, sharing the history of craftsmanship in North Staffordshire & why it is important to engage in & sustain craftsmanship, in particular exposure to a younger generation who may not have experienced a slower production line before.

title: MM.24.BC
description: This project is an exploration of place. Inspired from the connections designed have to the landscapes surrounding hometown. Throughout this project, a manifesto, describing the approach & thought process behind.

title: MM.24.BJ
description: The fast-paced growth culture of our world leaves us with a lack of harmony with the natural world. It is crucial to create bonds with each other & the earth we live with to better cherish the gift of our environment & protect the sanctity. How can we be good ancestors?

title: MM.24.CW
description: Symbiocene is a conceptual collection set one million years in the future, presented as couture accessories, exploring the eventual evolution of Homo sapiens. Aims to immerse the viewer in this apocalyptic reality & provoke conversations around the future of humanity, the appreciation of nature & the current climate crisis. Our priority should be the resilience of earth's ecosystems.

title: MM.24.EAS
description: Project theme around nature & the great outdoors while countering the effects of the winter blues. Materials were chosen for their innate ability to bring warmth & grounding to the environment, essential for creating a therapeutic haven.
keywords: ["Connected", "The East Riding, Yorkshire", "Contemporary", "Interior, Meditation Space", "Wellness", "Organic Forms"]

title: MM.24.EDOB
description: Girls Night is an evocative installation project exploring the complex metamorphosis from girl to womanhood. It is a multifaceted celebration of the friction & fluidity that define the ascent from girlhood to womanhood. The pearl emerges as a potent symbol, embodying the connection between young & old, vintage & modern.

title: MM.24.EHJD
description: As a young adult who has grown up with anxiety for climate, designer feel there is not enough said or done to care for the corals. Coral bleaching was unknown to her. Throughout pieces, she intend to produce a message displaying hope for these wonderful creatures & show the risk they are in so as humankind needs to protect them.

title: MM.24.JBF
description: Project explored disabled identity for Dream of Sleep. Multi-media approach to design pieces inspired by comfort, experimentation & joy of colour.

title: MM.24.LAH
description: Inspiration from four prominent mountain ranges around the world: Snowdonia, the Himalayas, the Atlas Mountains, & the Rocky Mountains. The distinctive landscapes, climates, & topographies of these regions, as well as the cultures of their inhabitants, have profoundly influenced work.
keywords: ["Altitude Retreats", "Snowdonia, Himalayas, Atlas & Rocky  Mountains", "Conceptualism", "Interior- Luxury Retreats", "Tactile", "Organic Forms"]

title: MM.24.LF
description: This project is inspired by designer love for electronic music, & the impact it has on our lives. Aiming to create a new form of escapism through textiles the same way music does. Inspired by sound, this project began from experimenting with cymatics, achieved by capturing sound waves in water through light reflections.

title: MM.24.MG
description: Aligned imagery & techniques with wellness theories & practices, enabling the collection to help aid anxiety control. Help the consumer in a physical & mental way by redirecting their focus to the fabric, embellishment, placement of material or design.

title: MM.24.RG
description: Up-cycles unconventional second-hand materials, giving materials a new lease of life and purpose. Climate action and sustainability are some of designer core values and is reflected throughout her practices.

title: MM.24.SMFM
description: The inspiration behind this project is the beguiling effect of hidden beauty.
