The contrast between outward appearance with an unexpected interior is concept that has been widely explored by creatives to engage the viewer. Project aims to explore the allure of minerals formed & concealed in the earth.

title: P.24.AT
description: Collection encapsulates the allure & deadly potency of poisonous flowers. It is a celebration of resilience & strength, honouring the spirit of women throughout history who have utilised deadly flowers in their quest for personal freedom.

title: P.24.CRD
description: Inspired by designer travels around Italy, exploring key aspects of Mediterranean lifestyle. Al Fresco, meaning in the fresh air, represents a movement for cultivating outdoor spaces & communal dining that serves as a purpose to reconnect & reflect. Influenced by the unhurried pace of coastal life, collection aims to convey the essence of leisurely evenings filled with warmth, laughter over shared meals.

title: P.24.EB
description: Designer is inspired by her grandma's life & struggles with memory after being diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease. Designed for fashion wish to celebrate the beauty in memory. Heavily inspired by nature, garden & vibrant florals.

title: P.24.EDUR
description: This collection puts the focus on recurring weeds, a beautiful & elemental part of the forest. Aims to merge the notions of order & lines with unruliness wilderness. Within the collection, many designs appear straight & orderly, as a nod to the man-made lines that we create; such as forest roads. Designer used single-line & unruliness drawings acts as a nod to the wild spirit of nature.

title: P.24.EM
description: A luxury, maximalist surface pattern collection for interiors. The project is based on designer's parents story together, showcasing various places they have lived: Yorkshire, Kew & Oman. The collection is inspired visually by different landscapes, architecture, & eclectic keepsakes they have accumulated from each place.

title: P.24.GB
description: An interior collection which explores the wellbeing benefits of green & blue spaces. These spaces have been proven to improve an individual's physical & mental health through regular interaction. Aim of the collection was to create domestic textiles inspired by these spaces which would allow the user to experience the wellbeing benefits within their own home.

title: P.24.HJ
description: In this project designer aimed to delve into the dynamic relationship, where the organic rhythms of nature intertwine with the precision & efficiency of machinery. Exploring the textures & natural marks found around the farm where her family used to work.

title: P.24.JY
description: The presence of nature, & arts & crafts has been proven to improve peoples mental health & make a difference to the development of skills in childhood. Project aims to provoke a sense of nostalgia from joyful memories designer can relate to from growing up in Loughborough.

title: P.24.KY
description: Collection that celebrates the beauty of human movement. It is a fusion of aesthetics & functionality, inspired by the dynamic & rhythmic cadence found in various sports. Aims to empower individuals to move freely with confidence, allowing them to fully embrace the joy of physical movement.

title: P.24.MJ
description: Designer has been inspired by grandparents who in their early careers, worked at the Shepshed Lace, a famous textile manufacturing for lace & elastic. Project aims to celebrate & honour traditions & craftsmanship that has been lost over time & to rediscover a once thriving industry. Explored the texture & shapes within lace & the machines to translate to print design.

title: P.24.SJ
description: Inspired by the West Wittering Beach, a place where designer have lots of happy memories with grandparents. Grandfather who suffers from Dementia & he sometimes remembers collecting driftwood, shells & stones from the beach to put around the garden. Aim of project is to bring the beauty of the beach into domestic interior with a focus on promoting wellbeing.

title: P.24.SOPC
description: Works blends vibrant hues & maximalist patterns, aiming to bring joy & inspiration into everyday life through the power of design. Through her journey, designer have drawn dancers & used inspiration from the likes of Keith Haring & Matisse to build a collection of printed designs which aim to celebrate & inspire creativity through performative arts.

title: W.24.AJN
description: Inspired by own experience of hearing loss, collection is a visual representation of the varying auditory experiences faced by the Deaf Community. Collection offers the added practical solution of a considered interior space that minimises sensory overload & eye fatigue for those carrying assistive hearing devices where background noise is difficult o tune out.

title: W.24.HQ
description: This hand woven project explores the convention of meaning through a collection of traditional textiles which show personal narratives. Kuba, renowned as the tribal home of cloth, became an inspiration to project with the traditional methods of handcrafted woven cloths. Explored personal reflection of meaning to the intricate craftsmanship of the Kuba cloth.

title: W.24.IM
description: Looking at a combination of calm & stressful stimuli, & how to combine them as away of progressive overload & exposure to irritating stimuli amongst the soothing textures & colours.

title: W.24.JP
description: Project aims to offer a holistic approach to wellness & fashion, reflecting a harmonious balance between elegance, sustainability & mental wellbeing. Incorporates spiritual elements like chakras, crystals & auras to guide the choice of colours, compositions, & shapes. Blending fashion influences to spiritual mindset to create retreat collection.

title: W.24.LEA
description: Inspired by her hometown of Bridlington, designer project aims to highlight & raise awareness of coastal erosion & sea-level rise in the UK. Erosion seen on the East Coast is main focus, designer own memory of the nearby cliffs & their worrying rapid erosion is the strong driving force behind this project.

title: W.24.LG
description: Project values regeneration & traceability. The 'New Perennial' movement values plant self-regeneration, muted colour, structure & layered texture. Project is conceptually based on these plant dormancy structures such as seed heads, bulbs, tubers, woody stems/crowns & turions, informing visual, compositional & material design choice.

title: W.24.OGN
description: This project serves as a poignant reminder of the urgent need for conservation efforts to safeguard this precious ecosystem & its inhabitants. Inspired by conservation photojournalist, Paul Hilton and 'Ulos' weaving, the ever growing need to keep the practice alive as generations go on & new technologies replace old traditions driven by exponential consumerism.

title: W.24.PSIN
description: Project focused on designer own reclamation of the word 'queer' as an exploration of identity, creating an immersive fantasy realm through woven textile forms. Main inspiration came from poetry written by Sappho- a Greek poet in the early 17th century- who often described women as being adorned with flowers, visual language.

title: W.24.SUNC
description: Concentrated on the geometric, tile-like formations in weaves & tapestry tiles.

title: W.24.TF
description: During a travel in Japan, designer learned about a type of textile called Furoshiki, the art of using cloth to warp an item to be transported or as a type of gift wrapping, by using knots to close the openings. Goal is to allow the end user to have freedom over how they want to use the fabric & to also cut down on waste that comes from gift wrapping & fast fashion.

title: IDP.23.AV
description: Unnecessary Necessity highlights the intrigue of humans love & greed for natural beauty leading to the exploitation of these creatures. Collection suitable for luxury market, meaning the product & materials used must align with that of the market; using animal products. yet project, create awareness of death which comes with beauty.
keywords: ["Unnecessary Necessity", "Amazonian Tribes, Victorian Obsession", "Contemporary", "Luxury Market: Bag", "Ephemeral", "Greed"]

title: IDP.23.ETAN
description: Cultivating Community. Inspired by & intended for use at The Community farm in Chew Magna, Somerset, where designer volunteer. Work explores flexible & functional design in order to suit & enhance the array of different indoor & outdoor activities that take place on site.

title: IDP.23.ETER
description: Upon the first Olympics being held in Athens, Greece in 1896, women were deliberately banned from taking part in all events. Fast Forward to 2020, the Tokyo Olympics have been billed the most gender neutral olympics of all time. Showcasing the evolution of the ultimate female runner from beginning of Greek mythology all the way into our modern day sporting.

title: IDP.23.JSAC
description: Florilegium explores the intersection of the transition of flora as they dry out & women of African cultural backgrounds finding spaces of unity, as they transition & adapt to unfamiliar cultures & environments. Exploring narratives that are translated into flowing designs that intersects.

title: IDP.23.SD
description: Merge' is based on short story & comic about dystopian future 50 years from now, reimagining the future relationship between humans & plants. This concept allowed designer to take on a more experimental approach, & the project has grown organically into its own collection.

title: MM.23.AT
description: An exploration of flowers & what they symbolise in different cultures. Linking family heritage with research, designer have taken inspiration from the Indian, Pakistani & Islamic art. Designs are a collection of scarf designs featuring digital print, embellishment & smocking.
keywords: ["Florals", "India, Pakistan & Islamic Art", "Contemporary", "Scarf Collection", "Family Heritage", "Repeated Motifs"]

title: MM.23.EI
description: Powered by Propaganda. We are manipulated & moulded to conform within a society in which decisions are made for us & propaganda is the norm. We need to take back control of our thoughts & our decisions to break away from the sway of the masses trained for consumption.

title: MM.23.EJ
description: The Golden Mole, an elusive creature hard to track & observe in its natural habitat. Society functions in a starkly different manner, with surveillance systems rife within our everyday, tracking, watching, controlling us. Designer love creating large scale pieces that question issues within our society.

title: MM.23.JS
description: Coal mining became chief source of labour & income for working class people in the North since the 19th century industrial revolution. The final pieces are art & sculpture based in the hope that they could be shown within the coal mining & textiles museums of Yorkshire to reflect on the industries past links.

title: MM.23.LW
description: Humanising Morbid Curiosity through Theatrical Oddities. Historically, we can see a pattern of human morbid curiosity; craving to view the unknown, rare & unconventional. The gap between the performer & the audience, in the hope this will encourage an inward as well as outward reflection.

title: MM.23.MPAT
description: Explores the spiritual & material nature of this world. Krishna is the supreme personality of godhead & Kali-yuga is the age of darkness. We are surrounded by this darkness & sin in this world. Collection illustrates avatars of Krishna whom manifest to prove righteousness over evil.

title: MM.23.MPEA
description: Project explores the mental attitude of artist throughout history & the impact this had on creative work. Focused specifically on artists Van Gogh, Andy Warhol, & Picasso as main muses for inspiration. Each piece represents a toxic substance or emotion that was felt from artist during their addiction.

title: MM.23.REDS
description: This work involved creating mixed media sculptures that combine hard surfaces & textile techniques. The work seeks a balance within the sculptures where not only the colour & form are considered, but also how the pieces are physically balanced.

title: MM.23.SC
description: This project explores the relationships between art, architecture & fashion through a gender neutral collection of adaptable textile pieces. Clothing able to enjoyed on & off the body, inspired by current concepts blurring the lines between work & home/public & private clothing.

title: MM.23.ST
description: Archive Revival' A fusion of antique & historical fashion. A collection of luxury handbags inspired by history & reimagined in a modern context, with the use of contemporary materials & traditional textiles.

title: P.23.AB
description: Designer hope to bring the essence of Indian wildlife into a luxury hotel in order to remind people of the enchanting beauty that comes from nature, as well as the importance of conserving it. Tiranga is based on the national bird of India, the peacock, which is famously used in folk art to portray wealth & luxury.

title: P.23.AO
description: Papilio' collection encapsulates the fragility of life. The symbolic nature of a butterfly is meant to connote new beginnings, transformation, renewal & change. The fluidity of the project explores the metamorphosis of Butterflies, encapsulating the motions of their life span, from the chrysalis to their end of life.

title: P.23.AR
description: When I Grow up, I Want to be a Cowboy' A 9 Later registered screen print. Inspired by the movies "The Magnificent Texan", & "Red River". (1949)

title: P.23.BO
description: Young Poland' draws inspiration from designer cultural background & upbringing. Collection incorporates historical symbolism & motifs that tell the story & reflect the identity of Poland. Explored the hidden symbols in the artwork of the Arts & Crafts period, depicted well-known myths & legends from around the country.
keywords: ["Young Poland", "Poland", "Art & Craft, Historical Symbolism", "Interior Print Collecion", "Folklore", "Botanical"]

title: P.23.CAK
description: This wellness interiors project looks at nature & the calming effect plants can have on a human. Surroundings can affect one's mood & mindset, as plants release a micro-substance called Phytoncides. Scientifically proven, when humans spend time immersed in nature, our bodies absorb these micro-substance which reacts with our hormones.

title: P.23.COM
description: Grow Together' project is a celebration of community gardening, highlighting the importance of access to an outside space & connecting with others within your community. Taking inspiration from current events, such as the recent food shortages & climate change, designer explored community gardens to become more self-sustaining.
keywords: ["Community Based", "The Culpeper Garden, Islington", "Impressionist", "Commercial Lifestyle Collection", "Sustainability", "Nature"]

title: P.23.EBOX
description: A high-end interior project designed for a living space, combining furnishings & art to create a collection of curiosities. The motifs are representative of designer own collection of objects that were gathered throughout her life which are symbolic of the passing of time.

title: P.23.EBUT
description: Remnants of the Landscape' interiors collection explores the unseen beauty areas within the Northwest of England that has been distorted by global warming. In particular, Harpur Hill Quarry, known as the deadly 'Blue Lagoon', in Buxton & Malham Cove in Settle.

title: P.23.ENH
description: A letter to John' is an interior collection, sustainably created, to help console & uplift loved ones after losing a partner in old age. Aim of project is to breathe life back into the spaces they shared, using inspiration from the memories, objects, photos & hobbies that illustrated their years together.

title: P.23.HL
description: Boa Vista' Project aims to encapsulate the nature, culture & history of the Cape Verde islands off the West Coast of Africa. Many residents now rely on tourism as their main form of income. Designer wanted to create prints for a tourist's beach villa, envisioning a business that would re-invest it's profit back into maintaining the beauty of archipelago.
keywords: ["Boa Vista", "Cape Verde, West Coast of Africa", "Sustainability", "Interior", "Wildlife", "Florals"]

title: P.23.HM
description: The Origin of Species. Project explores textile designs for a luxury autonomous automotive vehicle that exists in the future. Inspired by nature & the ability that it has to evolve & grow, the aims of this collection were to utilise biophilic design elements that can bring the outdoors in.

title: P.23.IL
description: Endless Summers' s a sustainable & non-permanent furnishing collection for elderly individuals moving into retirement homes. The aim is to fuse together residents personal memories- turning somewhat 'clinical spaces' into bright & bold places & overall, creating a place where someone would be happy to call their home.

title: P.23.JM
description: United by Difference' encompasses a portrayal of neurodiversity that delves deeply into the distinct experiences, strengths, & challenges encountered by many individuals with ASD & ADHD, including designer. Work explores the neurodivergent phenomenon of masking where individuals suppress their true selves to fit into neurotypical-based world.

title: P.23.MEH
description: The British Isles are rich with native folklore, rituals & superstitions that have shaped what we believe in today. 'Lore' aimed to create an interior collection that is a celebration of the weird & wonderful things that make up our collective imagination & bring communities together.

title: P.23.PS
description: Echoes of Youth' encapsulates joyful events experienced throughout designer teenage years into early adulthood. Inspired by countless, personal treasured memories filled with laughter & happiness. Created an energetic fun feeling encouraging others to look back on their own nostalgic memories.

title: P.23.PVR
description: Home is Not a Place' project seeks to explore the effect of migration on print, design, fashion, & our society. Primary research stems from Brixton, home to diverse community & businesses that are fighting against gentrification to preserve London's Carribbean cultural experiences. Implemented the traditional African textiles.

title: P.23.RS
description: Conservation within the Scilly Isles' Inspired by childhood trips to the islands with family, these islands is significant to designer as it is filled with memories. The islands is dedicated to keeping the species specific to the island & visitors come to the island for its beauty therefore respecting the environment & their habitats.

title: P.23.SN
description: An Elephant Never Forgets. A 1970's inspired printed textile collection intended for a dementia village in South Africa. Designer wanted to include sensory & interactive textiles such as fidget ball. Incorporating the remarkable memory of the African elephant into collection serves as a meaningful symbol, acknowledging the potential loss of memory in residents.

title: P.23.SO
description: What lies behind the façade' is an unisex transitional streetwear collection inspired by the architecture surrounding the City of London & Canary Wharf. By delving deeper into how light has an impact on the imagery projected onto glass, design development started from detailed gouache paintings, leading to photographic collages.
keywords: ["Architecture", "City of London & Canary Wharf", "Contemporary", "Unisex Transitional StreetWear", "Geometrics"]

title: P.23.STHB
description: Shattered Beauty' intertwines Islamic art with mental health. Collection of scarfs that have been designed to symbolise the struggles of those with mental health illnesses. It represents the idea that despite the mental health suffering, there is still beauty to be found in the fragments.

title: W.23.CM
description: Fish Are Friends. Designer made fabrics that provoke thoughts of the oceans & ocean life, by using materials that harm both. Cotton using an obscene amount of water to farm, drying up seas in the process. Ghost gear discarded or lost fishing equipment that has been washed up on beaches, which is also deadly to ocean life.

title: W.23.KG
description: Project focuses on creating adaptive fashion. Inspiration derived from designer's friend who has Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome. She regards fashion, particulary colourful garments, as allowing for expression of her disabled identity & enables positive dialogue surrounding disability.

title: W.23.MC
description: Inspired by cave & rock forms, designer explored the relationship between hard & soft textiles. A key part of inspiration was the city of Nottingham, & visual inspiration from the underground cave network within the city centre.
keywords: ["Caved", "City of Nottingham", "Contemporary", "Interior Caf\u00e9 Space", "City Centre", "Organic Forms"]

title: IDP.22.EH
description: Collection inspired by architecture, geometric design & 60's pattern & influences. It features elements of reversibility & customisation, to aid in increasing the emotional durability, use & lifespan of the garments- traversing seasons. Modularity within fashion is a growing contemporary trend that enables consumers to achieve multiple looks.

title: IDP.22.EPHE
description: It's a neutral thing is a performance fashion textile collection, digitally produced to highlight the gender divide of the 1950's. Framing the 1950's in today's light helps question whether we are right to treat the glamour, colour & upbeat frivolousness of the era as vintage nostalgia or a poor representation of equality.

title: IDP.22.GL
description: We (gene)Rate Margate' is an inclusive, playful community initiative. Interactive sensory designs are featured within 3 'pods', Audition, Tactition & Vision, each designed to highlight the universal benefits of play. The space encourages intergenerational interactions that aid cognitive development in children.

title: IDP.22.IF
description: A couture collection that tells the story of pandora box. Greek mythology, 16th century baroque artwork & the Faberge eggs inspired the heavily embellished & theatrical beaded masks. This manifests an element of mystery & objectifies the looks allowing the audience to be immersed in the story.

title: IDP.22.MW
description: Euphoric Feelings, is designed to help individual feel a light-hearted release from any daily struggles through immersive environments. Visualised in a large-scale context, the idyllic experience is depicted through both visual and sound stimuli. The collection delves into that temporary feeling of europhia.

title: MM.22.AEM
description: The Lost Gardens of Keepers Cottage' explores the deep history & ancestry of designer 100-year-old game keeper's cottage in Fenwick, Doncaster which has been passed down through generations within the family. Collection is fun & nostalgic, creating a personal & engaging response to family history.

title: MM.22.AHOB
description: Parabellum' is a Latin phrase that can be translated to 'prepare for war'. This conceptual, luxury womenswear collection evolves the characteristics of classic European Renaissance armour into contemporary fashion, body adornment & jewellery design. Inspired by Joan of Arc's influences of both strength & integrity throughout the battles.

title: MM.22.ALEF
description: Rural Escape', revolve around the concept of escaping the bustle of urban life to be surrounded by rural areas. Taking inspiration from the natural environment, designer looked closely at nature & the awakening & dying of plants for photography & drawings as post the Covid pandemic, people are concerned about their mental & physical health.

title: MM.22.CH
description: Into Isherwood' collection for conceptual theatre, based off Christopher Isherwood's 1935 novel, 'Mr Norris Changes Trains'. The collection explores themes such as fetishism & gender non-conformity, with contrasting elements such as war, secrecy & violence. All of which are prevalent within Isherwood's story.

title: MM.22.EH
description: Refabled' aims to reduce the throwaway culture in fashion, by promoting the renewal of existing clothes. The brand is focused on circularity by encouraging 'more use per user', whilst also supporting & sustaining the jobs in fashion worldwide. Instead of buying a whole new garment, consumers can buy a handcrafted.

title: MM.22.EOG
description: The Worker's Vale' realises an eclectic collection of bespoke, site-specific interior pieces that revels in the history of designer South-West hometown, Frome & nature's surprising role in this industrial tale. Bridging the gap between the old & new, & nature & man.

title: MM.22.ES
description: Bubble Tea Light, a captivating culmination of the hard and soft; Bubble Tea Light is the first in a collection of playful and tactile lighting pieces combining both sculpture and functionality. Mixed media object designer amalgamating experimental ceramic and glaze practice with tactile sculptural forms.

title: MM.22.FC
description: Fragility' focuses on nature as a tool for healing with the idea of the mind being fragile & delicate. The movement of nature represents the chaotic thoughts & daily battles of people suffering with anxiety.

title: MM.22.GA
description: How little British wool is worth has inspired project 'Flock'. Heritage, regionality & sustainability underpin design process. Inspired by 18th & 19th century smocks, the embroidery designs had a deep connection to the makers, their community & region.

title: MM.22.GG
description: 6 Locations' explores not only the functional attributes of mycelium, but also its aesthetic potential. Conceptually based on 6 locations significant to designer, each sculpture references these places, visually compositionally. Resulting sculptures highlight both the beauty, & compositional versatility, that mycelium can possess.

title: MM.22.IP
description: Give the World a Good Soup is a celebration of community & culture in the East Midlands, utilising local manufacturing offcuts & dead-stock fabrics. The name is derived from the shop front marketing of a Chinese restaurant in Birmingham, & symbolises this idea of coming together.
keywords: ["Community Culture", "Birmingham, East Midlands", "Abstract", "High-End Unisex Fashion", "Local Symbols", "Geometric"]

title: MM.22.JW
description: Cladogenesis is a bespoke unisex avant-garde millinery collection, designed to be worn for high-end performance and special high publicised occasions. Inspired by Charles Darwin's theory of Evolution and Natural selection.

title: MM.22.KM
description: I would rather be in Hawaii' is a collection which has been inspired by designer own personal experience visiting mental health centre across the North of England. Aim of project is to create a positive & happy space to allow young families to visit their ill family member in a safe, relaxed environment.

title: MM.22.LJ
description: The Sans at Home' An interior collection designed for cosy cabin living. Having lived in Cornwall all her life, designer have been lucky to have the beach on the door step. Specifically looking into the organic patterns in the sand caused by the movement of the sea as well as magnified images of unique sand shapes.

title: MM.22.MDUN
description: The concept of 'Secret' stemmed from research into hidden disabilities & the comfort that textiles can provide. Inspired by the bright colours & textural aspects of coral & sea creatures. Influenced by the Japanese art Kintsugi, piecing broken pieces together with gold, a metaphor for embracing your flaws & imperfections.

title: MM.22.RA
description: This luxury fashion collection references the mystical Pamela Colman-Smith & her Art Nouveau tarot deck. The fabrics were created to empower & celebrate women today, whilst reflecting the societal struggles of the past.

title: MM.22.SC
description: Dunluce: Coastal Legends' This project aims to celebrate the beauty of the North Coast of Ireland which is a comforting & inspiring place that designer spent most of her childhood visiting. Translate the overlooked history & beauty of this location through a collection, consisting of bespoke textile jewellery.
keywords: ["Coastal Legends", "Coast of Ireland", "Innovative", "Bespoke Textile Jewellery", "Historical", "Organic Forms"]

title: MM.22.SD
description: Langdon Lane' breaks the mould by incorporating inclusive elements of interactivity, tactile surface textures, braille & sound to provide additional interest & meaning for patients. Drawing on two Japanese concepts, ShinrinYoku & Natsukashii, designer inspired from her grandmother's garden & plants.

title: MM.22.TS
description: Home Grown' is a womenswear fashion collection that promotes awareness of biodiversity and encourages the protection of biodiversity through rewilding. It is important for everyone to understand that together we can make changes to benefit our planet if we all start by "looking in the mirror" and make our own small changes.

title: P.22.AB
description: The Crafted Harvest' is a joyful, decorative & eclectic collection which is based upon craft & culture. Suitable for a range of domestic interior spaces, the timeless textile pieces are made to be cherished. Collection has been heavily influenced by designer's grandparents farming heritage, Grange Farm in Langar, Nottinghamshire.

title: P.22.AD
description: Bespoke English Countryside interior collection is aimed at complimenting the interiors of both historic & contemporary homes to deliver an elevated sense of luxury in a relaxed setting. Inspired from the surroundings of family home in West Sussex, where designer have lived for 22 years.

title: P.22.AHC
description: In Memory is a domestic interiors collection, based around the North Norfolk Coast. The collection aims to bring a source of nostalgia & peacefulness encompassing the idea of memory, recollection, & celebrating life. Featuring tidal scenes, beach walks, drifting sailboats & coastal meadows.

title: P.22.AHEA
description: Hybrid Jungle' is an eccentric interiors collection designed for luxurious hotel spaces. Inspired by mythology & the surreal, the concept is about escapism. This is done through the creations of 'hybrid' animals & plants that could only exist in a fantastical 'jungle' world.

title: P.22.DN
description: The Cabinet collection is a project that encapsulates designer feelings about finishing a degree in the UK & shows a romanticised perspective of how she feel about this stage of life. Created a visual diary to reminisce this time in the form of coming-of-age movie.

title: P.22.EK
description: The Pelagos Project aims to celebrate the long-standing traditions of Hellenic culture & the anchoring impact of Greek shipping on its contemporary identity. Project looks at the industrial aspects of cargo ships & tugboats that people don't generally associate with Greece.

title: P.22.ENF
description: 'Shadows on the Sands of Time'. Collection reflecting life & the subsequent beauty of what is left behind. The world is so caught up in what is ahead & what is new. Simply slowing down & reflecting on the past reveals the nostalgic charms, wonder, & love that is left behind.

title: P.22.EPUL
description: Concept explores our relationship with the earth, & how women can overcome the darkness of oppression by drawing strength from the way the earth renews itself, constantly bringing forth new life, & how Gaia's secrets- the earth's mineral, vegetable, & animal wealth- can enable us to reclaim & celebrate our own feminine power.

title: P.22.FM
description: Natures Highlander is an assemblage of bespoke wearable art pieces that make up a trans-seasonal collection, emphasising on hand crafted processes. Seeking to connect back to Scottish heritage, designer wanted the collection to unearth the roots of family history.

title: P.22.GAJ
description: Coastal Connections' is an interior design collection originated from a strong passion for Cornish lifestyle, with its scenic landscapes, rich culture & the ever-changing energy of the Atlantic coast. Multidisciplinary collection aims to be a celebration of memories, the local people & their natural surroundings.

title: P.22.HB
description: Make love, not War' is a unisex fashion collection inspired by the German occupation of Guernsey during WWII & the heart-warming love letters between islanders who were separated as a result of the war. The brutalist concrete fortifications which disrupt the rugged landscape of the island.

title: P.22.HPAR
description: Silent Pool' is a conceptual unisex fashion project. Through imagery linked to the local folklore tale of Surrey's Silent Pool, this personal collection tells the story of the distinctive Japanese Willow Pattern plate. Is meant to introduce longevity & allow wearers to share garments with friends.

title: P.22.HPHI
description: Ghost Town of Jazira al Hamra, currently standing as one of the United Arab Emirates last remaining traditional villages, the crumbling desolate landscapes, weathered by the desert sun are championed throughout this womenswear collection to celebrate the importance of heritage, with contemporary edge.
keywords: ["Ghost Town", "Jazirah al Hamra,United Arab Emirates", "Contemporary", "Womenswear", "Forgotten Treasure", "Heritage"]

title: P.22.IB
description: The Great Outdoor. A hand-crafted collection that takes inspiration initially from the Scandinavian concept of 'frilufsliv', encompassing their appreciation of nature in all weather conditions as well their common belief that there is no such thing as bad weather, only bad clothing.

title: P.22.JB
description: Piece of Paradise' is an interior collection designed to create an immersive jungle retreat for application in a luxury spa hotel where guests can relax, unwind & escape from reality. Inspired by the Amazon Rainforest, this collection focuses primarily on the flora, fauna & foliage of the forest.

title: P.22.JMC
description: Unity' is a bold & energetic fashion collection, celebrating the wonders of community. More so now than ever before, our community is key to our survival providing us with the support needed to live & work with each other in harmony, & co-exist together. Sense of inclusivity, this collection is unisex.

title: P.22.LS
description: Based on the idea of feminism with women supporting women in a sisterhood.

title: P.22.LZ
description: Brutal Utopia, focusing on creating robust, long lasting textiles that can be used for years, Brutalist architecture are translated through tactile multi-media work.

title: P.22.MROBE
description: Collection celebrating the landscapes, architecture, and decorative traditions of Provence, France. Each piece draws from a specific Provencal inspiration—floral motifs from the oleander plant, lavender field patterns, village silhouettes, traditional ironwork, and classic embroidery styles—reimagined through modern digital processes.

title: P.22.MH
description: "The butterfly said to the sun. They can't stop talking about my transformation. I can only do it once in my lifetime. If only they knew they can do it at any time & in countless ways." John Dodinsky

title: P.22.MROBI
description: Hope' is a collection of mens Autumn, Winter fashion prints, made up of digital and screen prints.

title: P.22.MRS
description: Inspired by a series of brisk, windy beach days along the Sussex coast with family and friends.

title: P.22.OC
description: I see the sea' is a contemporary lifestyle print collection dedicated to designer love & deep connection to North Cornwall, created for adventures & days along the coast, be it family holidays or day trips with friends. This has always been a place of calmness & enjoyment for designer, as well as holding vivid memories of childhood experiences.

title: P.22.PML
description: Carved Landscapes' is a unisex fashion collection that focuses on longevity & Craft. The collection visually explores the relationship between nature & man-made materials with the use of dead-stock fabrics & hand crafted processes. Henry Moore & Barbara Hepworth have inspired the collection.'

title: P.22.RD
description: Impact' demonstrates the up-cycling process of the airbag & its characteristics high strength, great flexibility, good heat resistance, ageing resistance & especially water resistance. Chosen to focus on automotive industry, which disposes of hundreds of thousands of tonnes of material each year.

title: P.22.SH
description: Inspired to create textile outcomes which act as a memorial, bring communities together through a lived experience. Acknowledging this significant time in history & the aftermath that followed consequently, people will learn about designer's experiences of this devastating day, allowing time to reflect & educate themselves on Tsunami.

title: P.22.VC
description: Inspiration comes from the mythological tales that narrate Diana's life as a Roman goddess. Sustainability is highly regarded by designer. Studying fabric recycling processes made it possible to create an easy to recycle collection that aims to minimise the impact at the end of a garment's life.

title: W.22.ALOW
description: The collection explores a personal reflection of escapism in the context of rugged coastal environment. Rich in tactile sensations & consumed in colour & texture, designer can escape from reality. While seeing the world in a blur the importance of texture becomes paramount.

title: W.22.ER
description: Coastal Nostalgia: An artistic woven collection inspired by the sea-side.

title: W.22.HAT
description: Bleaching Beauty' is a series of woven textiles designed to explore the devastating effects that coral bleaching has had on the world's most beautiful coral colonies.

title: W.22.IH
description: 'A Metaphor of Love' is a bespoke woven interiors collection which explores the connection between motherhood & mum's homegrown garden. Being a mother & raising children can be a tricky & tiring job, so having a space where designer mother was able to relax & put the world behind her for a brief moment.

title: W.22.MDUM
description: 'SOS: Weaving for Coral Restoration' explores how an elevated understanding of material properties & the weave process can be exploited to create the unexpected surface textures & 3-dimensional forms in woven fabrics. Outcome: a discussion about the role of weaving process could have in the global efforts to restore coral reefs.

title: W.22.TBB
description: 'Adventure awaits' is a series of woven textiles designed with outdoor living in mind. As people continue to engage with year-round, all-weather adventures, discovering new places & disconnecting from the everyday, products that fit into this lifestyle will become increasingly important.

title: IDP.21.AA
description: This project is a contemporary couture collection that is inspired by fluid elements of 1960's Psychedelia to create expressive designs for young men that desire liberation from the societal constraints of gender stereotypes. Open-minded collection, fluid & full of positive energy which is suggested by the bright bold colours.

title: IDP.21.AP
description: The project explores how symbiotic organisms such as lichen & moss, depend on one another just as we as humans do. During the Covid-19 pandemic, it has become obvious that we need & crave a connection to other humans & when this is restricted to taken away, we no longer thrive, only survive.

title: IDP.21.AR
description: Collection is based on the two sides of tarot. Many people find tarot a source of stability & comfort, but others have said it has a feeling of foreboding & tempting fate. Pulling on items from the past & giving insight into the future is a fascination that has drawn people to the mystery of tarot for centuries.

title: IDP.21.CS
description: Where the Land Meets the Sea' is an interior project inspired by textures found along the South Devon coastline. The project puts emphasis on bridging the gap between traditional & digital textile processes in order to create innovative & contemporary interior design products.

title: IDP.21.EH
description: Synaesthesia- The Hidden Sense' is a material & colour-led exploration into how textiles can be used to create a sensorial experience. The aim is to raise awareness of the phenomenon of synaesthesia & how we, as humans, perceive reality by creating a fun & playful space.

title: IDP.21.EMC
description: Designer created a campaign aimed at tackling the climate crisis through protest and activism. Sustainability & design activism are the driving forces which inspire work in living a sustainable lifestyle. Project is intended to influence people's mindsets through the form of art.

title: IDP.21.HW
description: Ephemerality utilises digital technologies to create a new data-informed natural world, experienced through virtual reality. Ephemeral elements have been captured as sound from the Somerset Mendips. Locations specifically selected for their role in elevating designer own wellbeing.

title: IDP.21.IM
description: DNA Diffraction is a future-forward project that links DNA genetic code & Rosalind Franklin's work in DNA X-Ray diffraction with health benefits. The outcome is a theoretical fashion garment that tracks the body's health & interacts with DNA/genetic code to reduce illness 7 the spread of viruses.

title: IDP.21.JL
description: Unseen Light' is a textile collection that shines a light on the unknown phenomenon of ligh pollution. The invention of artificial light in the early 20th century has transformed the lives of human beings. Yet it brings about its own consequences in light pollution, whose impact are only just seeing in the modern world.

title: IDP.21.KPT
description: The project looks to build a relationship between the past & the present by using visual research of family heirlooms to inspire material development. Influenced by designer brands including Ganni, Shrimps, Cecile Bahnsen & Stine Goya, the collection includes statement prints, silhouettes & embroidery.

title: IDP.21.LRS
description: Marks of Tokyo' is a collection inspired by the 1964 period in Tokyo, looking into details from the Olympics & surrounding inspiration from that time. Designer is curious about consumer behaviour & spotting emerging trends.
keywords: ["Marks of Tokyo", "1964 Olympics, Tokyo", "Contemporary", "Men's Streetwear", "Consumer Behaviour", "Abstracted Forms"]

title: IDP.21.MG
description: The new normal' is inspired by taking shapes, form & movement from people's daily movement & activities during the pandemic & how they are now spending their time. Objective is turning a grey & abandoned shopping centre into an eye catching, bold & vibrant public space fostering social interaction.

title: IDP.21.ML
description: Time For Reflection' defines the designer's key inspiration sources, a collation of previous successful collections; Enhanced Naturals & Seaweed Florals. Time for Reflection encapsulates the concept of rural landscape scenery becoming the artwork focus within a room.

title: IDP.21.MN
description: Work is focused on bringing joy & a sense of wonder to interior spaces. Project was inspired by photography designer took of waterfalls during many adventures, predominantly in Croatia & across the UK. The splashes, textures & expressive qualities of waterfalls along with the sense of escapism & wonder.

title: IDP.21.PEG
description: Inspired by science & hypothetical biochemistry, textile design approach & outcomes heavily reflect this. Designer combined extensive research into relevant scientific discoveries in the context of our own human mortality, which fuels to create high-fashion textile in response to the idea of future wear.

title: IDP.21.SD
description: Collection is about the sounds & the maths of Kathak, a traditional North Indian classical dance style. Exploring the connection between maths & kathak, a combination of two subjects that designer have always been passionate about.
keywords: ["Kathak Rhythm", "Kathak, North Indian Dance Style", "Contemporary", "Womenswear", "Spring/Summer", "Natural Forms"]

title: IDP.21.SJ
description: This project aims to create interactive textile solutions for a charity allotment for adults with mental health issues. By creating different types of screening & movable seating, the project explores how interactive textiles can provide a stimulating environment to encourage confidence amongst service users.

title: IDP.21.SM
description: Illustrating Womanhood' is an age-inclusive fashion collection inspired by the influential women in designer's life. She has explored the emotions & bonds that she shares with the women that have helped shape her identity. Designed in a very bold & liberating way as all indicators point to the world being a different place.

title: IDP.21.SP
description: Mirai meaning 'future' is inspired by the rise of the digital age as distinction between virtual & real become ever more fluid. Japan, being one of the leaders of futuristic developments has provided designer with the initial inspiration for this project.

title: MM.21.ABAR
description: Draws inspiration from unique architecture & the colours of urban environments to create purposeful & mindful designs. Photography of dark urban settings, inspired the theme of exposure at night, highlighting one's open vulnerability & uneasiness. Also strengthened through studies of tech-noir cinematography.

title: MM.21.ABUT
description: Since the dawn of humanity, there has been an innate desire within us to decorate the world. The oldest discovered decorative markings were found in South Africa & date back 100,000 years. This pattern carved into rock announced the beginning of design & culture.

title: MM.21.AMK
description: Nota Bene Potentia is a collection of textile artworks intended for domestic interiors. It reflects nature's organic elegance combined with the incongruent patterns & textures of individual natural forms. The collection explores the potential of the living world.

title: MM.21.ARM
description: This collection represents the movement of water, its reflective quality & how it reacts to both natural & artificial stimuli, being light & pollution, inspired by how the development of modern industries caused havoc to our oceans & their inhabitants.

title: MM.21.BB
description: Daydream is a project inspired by designer own experience & the ability to escape reality through your own mind.

title: MM.21.BJ
description: Project aims to create interior space for a modern-day Dove Cottage, a home away from home that provides a temporary escape where one can reconnect with nature. Each tree included in the collection is symbolic of different aspects of spiritual well-being.

title: MM.21.CC
description: The North Coast project is designed for an interior of a contemporary family home. The project is based around a Scandinavian style minimalistic colour palette with influences of the North coast. The project focuses on shape & texture inspired by the rocks & cliffs seen at the coast: Whitby in North Yorkshire.

title: MM.21.EC
description: Sustainability is a vital route for the fashion & textiles industry in today's climate & is the main basis for this project. Focusing on circular fashion, designer worked on up-cycling damaged garments, using scraps materials & fabrics. Inspired by the Japanese art of Kintsugi & Forgotten Taxa vital to our eco system.

title: MM.21.EKF
description: P.T.L 'Play!Touch!Learn' is an interactive & sensory instillation that is a playful, colourful & stimulating space, created for & inspired by children with special educational needs. Appealing to multiple senses, these pieces would be able to sit together in an installation & provide a stimulating play space for children with MSI.
keywords: ["P.T.L. Play, Touch, Learn", "Contemporary", "Play Space, Interior", "M.S.I. Multi-Sensory Impairment", "Abstracted Forms"]

title: MM.21.FS
description: The Garden in Ephesus is a collection designed for a co-working public interior space that facilitates collaboration & creativity. The prototype visualise the theories of the Pre-Socratic philosopher Heraclitus & create an environment that sparks imagination just as the garden in Ephesus thousands of years ago.

title: MM.21.IM
description: The inspiration for this project was designer memories she had of Philippines plants & fruits she was surrounded by during her childhood. These colourful festivals reflect the mixed cultures which become embedded into Filipino culture which has influenced textiles through their weaving & embroidery.

title: MM.21.JL
description: A truly personal & sentimental project, inspired by decorative china designs, family history & childhood memories. Driven by the use of reclaimed materials, featuring abstract motifs, structural designs & bold colours. The collection is brought to life through the use of hand processes.

title: MM.21.KB
description: Digital Dystopia' is an exploration of the all-consuming digital age. Specialist hand-worked processes are combined with digitally-driven techniques, to push embroidery & embellishment beyond the familiar. An eclectic collection of digital prints & beaded garments.

title: MM.21.MM
description: Experimental approach that underpins work, produced design for fashion intended to be worn in performance. Consideration is given to how garments interact with movement, lighting & space & how they are viewed from different perspectives. Designs are often intended to represent an artistic approach rather than pure functionality.

title: MM.21.MSIM
description: Project has been created with the post-pandemic world in mind, introducing new beginnings through fashion, with the use of colour & design. This has been inspired by street art & influences from the 1960's fashion, film & pop culture- hence the bold prints, vibrant colours & textures.

title: MM.21.MSTR
description: Reborn is an elegant, highly embellished, & yet playful collection that challenges conventional beauty due to its unusual yet grotesque subject matter of animal skeletons & snake skins. The collection's composition are significantly inspired by the natural pattern, forms & symmetry found in nature.

title: MM.21.NB
description: A multi-sensory collection depicting a garden. With an emphasis on the idea of 'interaction', the collection is made to communicate through a multi-sensory experience, specifically sight & touch. The theory behind Ronald Reel's Teeter Tooter wall served as a great inspiration piece for the narrative.

title: MM.21.NP
description: This conceptual interior design collection is inspired by the best known commercial example of biomimicry, Velcro. Inspiration taken from Scandinavian influences with the balance between comfort & minimalism resembling modernism has encouraged the use of materials.

title: MM.21.RH
description: The project theme is the relationship between two unique & contrasting cultures which forms the ethnic heritage & identity of the designer behind the collection. It is a multicultural fusion which blends Indian & Scottish ethnicity & heritage.

title: MM.21.RK
description: This textile investigation reimagines the conventional geometry & shapes existing in fashion tropes by drawing from the unpredictability of viscous liquid forms. This is conceptually supported by drawing inspiration from the Club Kid drag subculture that was prevalent in New York in the 80's & 90's.
keywords: ["Drip", "Club Kid Drag, New York 80's & 90's", "Art in Motion", "Fashion Collection", "3-Dimensional", "Geometrics"]

title: P.21.ABURK
description: This project explores the importance of the outdoor space & how the garden surrounding designer home, as well as National Trust gardens that granted access to over the past year, have provided designer with inspiration & solace. Aimed to celebrate these environments, creating bold & colourful interior prints.
keywords: ["A Garden of One's Own", "Charleston House, Bloomsbury Group, East Sussex", "Contemporary", "Interior", "Nature", "Abstracted Forms"]

title: P.21.ABURN
description: The basis of this project is to zoom closer to nature, particularly looking into detail at the variety of colour, textures & patterns that form naturally on the bark of trees. The primary idea behind this project is to emphasise the importance of preserving & protecting nature, because of its immense benefits & resources.

title: P.21.AG
description: The season-less collection conveys the decorative floral and jewelled motifs with extravagant silhouettes of quilted garments and excessive flowing fabrics.

title: P.21.AM
description: Inspired by the 60's & early 70's Hippie Culture, particularly the renowned 1969 Woodstock Festival, designer have created a modernised sustainable textile print collection to be placed in a co-living interior space. Aiming to encourage togetherness & community, the prints aim to uplift those living within the space.
keywords: ["Earth, Us, Self", "1969 Woodstock Festival, Bethel, New York", "Sustainability, Hippie", "Interior", "Community Based", "Abstracted Forms"]

title: P.21.AW
description: The natural world has many similarities to mankind. It is precious, ever-changing & able to adapt to every condition of life. 'Pharmacognosy' explores nature's medicine, using scientific resources to discover why nature is vital for mental healing & how it has played an important role in the development of modern psychiatric treatments.

title: P.21.BM
description: Lost Bohemia is a sense of nostalgia of the time that has passed after a whirlwind year of isolation & government restrictions, a yearning to socialise & be able to go out in the evening & enjoy a drink while surrounded by friends. Inspired by the creativity of the 1930's, collection brings together the past's colours, shapes.

title: P.21.CT
description: Harvested by hand' is a collection designed for longevity that promotes natural & traditional techniques & a hand-drawn aesthetic. It combines the concept of rewinding with the emerging grow your own movement in the hope of inviting & inspiring users to spend more time in their kitchen & gardens.

title: P.21.DH
description: Push boundaries by exploring the beauty in the unexpected. Designer gathered inspiration from observations of the world around her & particularly from travel experiences.
keywords: ["Vulnerable Entities", "Ecuador & Amazon Rainforest, South America", "Contemporary", "Interior", "Botanical", "Natural Forms"]

title: P.21.EBR
description: Industrial Bloom offers a personal response surrounding the Industrial Revolution & pre-war optimism & beauty within the North East. A variety of engineered digital designs & screen prints curated to form the final collection.

title: P.21.EC
description: Fragile Fusion' aims to bring social awareness to the issues of consumerism & our throw away society, aiding this by researching into technology & plastic pollution, unplugging society from electronics & consumers by venturing into the healthy free outdoors.

title: P.21.EGIR
description: Senses of Subsistence derives from the desire to share the cultural appreciation that subsistence farmers & their local communities have in looking after the land & its future. The idea behind this project is to illustrate the ways that whole communities rely on what they raise & cultivate locally.
keywords: ["Senses of Subsistence", "Ethiopian & Uganda Heritage", "Contemporary", "Interior", "Community Based", "Natural Forms"]

title: P.21.EGRA
description: Eden is a home interior collection designed to create indoor & outdoor social eating areas within the home. Focusing on nature's textures, shape & form, it is a comfort blanket helping us ease back into socialising with our loved ones from the sanctuary of our homes.

title: P.21.ESHA
description: Inspired by the extravagance & flare brought on by the social & economic changes of the 1920's. Project brings to life this atmosphere, in a quirky & memorable way, capturing a modern stylised interpretation of 'the Roaring '20s'. Aims to inspire & capture the attention of guests at a large luxury hotel & party venue in London.

title: P.21.ESHE
description: Modern Heritage' is inspired by designer family tree. Collection is inspired by Pugin & the Arts & Crafts era in which has influenced designs. Designer have tried to make own prints by developing own style.
keywords: ["Modern Heritage", "Houses of Parliament, UK", "Art & Craft, Contemporary", "Interior", "Eclectic", "Geometrics"]

title: P.21.ESUT
description: Rock is a lifestyle collection which investigates colour, a unique place, & the people that live there. The final collection is primarily all screen printed with great attention to detail & finishing, for fashion & lifestyle pieces.

title: P.21.FL
description: Old Tong Farm is a collection that captivates designer personal response to her grandmother's landscape garden located in the picturesque of Kent. The sentimental aim was to represent the sheer beauty of the natural British garden & to shine the light on each specific section of the garden.
keywords: ["Old Tong Farm", "The Garden of England, Kent", "Contemporary", "Interior", "Spring/Summer", "Botanical"]

title: P.21.GN
description: This collection explores two locations, Bridlington & Whitby, & investigates the fishing industry, lifestyles & culture that this industry presents. This project investigates & translates what these areas represent more deeply, referencing the historical routes behind the idealistic qualities associated with seaside towns, but also the industrial atmosphere.
keywords: ["A Way of Life", "Bridlington & Whitby, East Yorkshire Coastline", "Contemporary", "Menswear", "Industrial Elements", "Abstracted Forms"]

title: P.21.HMW
description: Italy in Bloom' an escapism collection is researching Italian cinefilm & the films from the 1950's/1960's. A bloom Italian love story, creating a collection of wear-forever pieces celebrating eternal love for fashion & sustainability.
keywords: ["Italy in Bloom", "Italian Cinefilm 1950's/1960's, Italy", "Escapism, Contemporary", "Womenswear", "Spring/Summer", "Natural Forms"]

title: P.21.ICHA
description: A personal response to the pandemic & intended for clients spending more time within their homes. Influenced by the modern nomad, designer aims to bring the cultural influence of India to the home environment to celebrate the theme of travel, exploration & hedonism.

title: P.21.IH
description: Beauty never dies, like energy, it merely transforms. When a flower slowly loses its life, it stays beautiful in terms of form & structure. The colouration & drying textures grasp at the fading life our loved ones who have passed on; lost but never forgotten.

title: P.21.IL
description: The Danish Way of Living' is a collection that explores Danish culture, architecture & landscapes, & offers an insight into the time designer spent living in this vibrant & beautiful city. Collection aims to capture the essence of the Danish lifestyle, morning pastries, cycling to work & reading by lakes.
keywords: ["The Danish Way of Living", "Danish Heritage, Copenhagen", "Contemporary", "Womenswear", "Autumn/Winter", "Geometrics"]

title: P.21.JF
description: Nature is the main aspect of project because of its diversity. 'Find Your Wild' is an interior print collection, inspired by designer previous wild experiences. Each design uses nature to portray various wild imagery, incorporating mark & texture to create interior designs.

title: P.21.JS
description: Collection is for a co-working office interior space with strong references to 80's interior  design through its stylised approach. The office is a space where workers can go to feel inspired & be surrounded by geometric & graphic prints which are known to alleviate general work/life stresses.

title: P.21.KC
description: Catch of the Day' is based on exploring the fun shapes & colours that often go unnoticed when you initially think of fishing harbours. Throughout this project designer has looked into her seaside town, Plymouth, paying particular attention to the local fishing harbour to create cohesive interior for coastal holiday homes.
keywords: ["Catch of the Day", "Seaside Town, Plymouth", "Contemporary", "Interior", "Industrial Elements", "Organic Forms"]

title: P.21.LA
description: Serpenti has derived from an admiration of the 70's free-spirited bohemian, rock & roll era. The collection features a selection of decadent prints inspired inspired by the hippie trail of the late 60's early 70's. Prints feature animal skin, florals influenced by chintz as well as Aztec & Indian motif & design.

title: P.21.LBOU
description: Collection is inspired by the 'Ethos Leave No Trace' which encourages us to leave places of natural beauty how we found them. The collection Leave No Trace is a commentary on how mankind has left a trace on the world during our development into modern society & therefore tackles the issues of Climate Change.

title: P.21.LBRI
description: La Pachamama' is an interior project that celebrates Peru & its landscape, textiles, culture & Inca stories & traditions. Designer adores the freedom, culture & new experiences which travel generates & wants to utilise this in her design work, creating an interior collection which provides escapism.
keywords: ["La Pachamama, Mother Earth", "Landscapes & Inca Stories, Traditions, Peru", "Escapism, Contemporary", "Domestic Interior", "Nature", "Abstracted Forms"]

title: P.21.LW
description: In a time when we have been deprived of the daily stimuli of everyday life, of people, variety, tactility, spontaneity & the pleasure of being around other humans. 'Soon' is a collection which looks back at the pleasures we have been denied in this whirlwind of a year, offering a way to escape, to relax & look back fondly.

title: P.21.MT
description: Colourful Life. Different snapshots of life collated together in a playful & colourful manner. A sense of nostalgia between friends but also the hobbies picked up during pandemic lockdown.

title: P.21.OM
description: Inspired by nature's elements, this collection is created for an artist's residence. Through designer playful style & contemporary use of colour & scale, 'Elements' is designed to encourage creativity, freedom & tranquility. Project portrays the four classical elements: Earth, Water, Fire & Air.

title: P.21.RBLA
description: Jewellery Box' is a luxury automotive collection designed for the modern-day Rolls Royce Phantom, which was launched in 1925. The bespoke collection explores 1920's jewellery a century on. The collection is split into two colour ways, the first being 'Phantom Crystal' & the second 'Phantom Antique'.

title: P.21.RC
description: A Future Sentiment' explores the need for a future of more sustainable design through a season-less. Men’s & Womenswear Collection. Sourcing remnant, surplus & sustainable fabrics without compromising on quality have been key to maintaining the integrity of this project.

title: P.21.RM
description: Curious' is an inclusive children's lifestyle brand that celebrates the beauty of our British countryside with the aim of inspiring young people of all backgrounds to learn about nature. Designed for nursery & playroom interiors in both home & school settings, the intention is to create enchanting environments for young people.

title: P.21.RS
description: The Sensational Now' is designed for a restaurant/bar, exploring navigation through the imagery of the night sky, stars, constellations, keys & compasses. This is similar to the late 19th to early 20th century, where the 1920's saw not only industrial & technological advances but also a boost in public's morale & attitude towards life.
keywords: ["The Sensational Now", "Metropolitan Museum, V&A, Tate", "Art Nouveau & Art Deco", "Interior", "Eclectic", "Geometrics"]

title: P.21.SH
description: Alchemy- The Secret Art is a bespoke interior collection that explores man's relationship with the cosmos & the influence of the stars on terrestrial events. Drawing on research from literary publications & alchemical artwork, the collection is inspired by the magic & mysticism surrounding the practice of alchemy.

title: P.21.SID
description: Regalia' is a collection inspired by female empowerment which takes reference from famous female women from the medieval era including the likes of Joan of Arc. One of the main idea for the project is the connection between the medieval theme & the motorcycle clothing application form from Joan of Arc wore armour.

title: P.21.SK
description: Rani: Queen' is a contemporary material celebration of designer rich Indian maternal ancestry, amassing a curated display of outcome orientated around Indian jewellery & traditional adornment.

title: P.21.SM
description: Inspired by childhood days which were filled with happy memories of laughter, joy & a carefree lifestyle, enjoying all the world had to offer with little or no worries. Project aims to encourage people to indulge in those memories while bringing this feeling of happiness & freedom back into their adult lives.

title: P.21.TS
description: The Garden Party', inspired by a variety of garden flowers. The inspiration behind the name of the project stemmed from watching Marie Antoinette. This sparked an idea to create a modern interior floral collection suitable for domestic home interiors, to be used in an outside home garden setting, lounge & kitchen area.
keywords: ["The Garden Party", "Marie Antoinette, Versailles Palace, France", "Contemporary", "Interior", "Spring/Summer", "Natural Forms"]

title: W.21.AJT
description: Inspired by fauvism and the idea of subverting natural landscapes using unnatural colours but also colours which evoke a sense of joy. Using research into colour theory the warmth in the colour palette was developed with the intent of bringing happiness and hope into homes.

title: W.21.AW
description: This project was inspired by mathematical principles, focussing on geometry, reflections & tessellating shapes. With an underlying concept of interconnection, collection was designed to be displayed in busy public spaces to encourage re-engagement & interaction between society, after the disjoin caused by the Covid19 pandemic.

title: W.21.CB
description: Fragmented Florals is an interior collection, inspired by nature & the manipulating of florals to create interesting marks & compositions. The collection has been designed intending to create pieces that are captivating & provide positivity.

title: W.21.CS
description: Portraiture is fascinating as it describes the human condition through expression, mark-making & colour. Furthermore, self-portraiture is a personal exploration of one's sense of self & emotion. Coming through a pandemic having spent a lot of time alone, this was opportunity to give a tangible definition to feeling.

title: W.21.DH
description: Inspiration taken from The Chilundu, the Malawi's national dress, garments design were created for the modern Malawian woman. Then, taking inspiration from the country's natural beauties, designed woven fabrics to be used in the assembly of the Chilundu ensembles.
keywords: ["The Warm Heart of Africa", "The Chilundu, Malawi", "Contemporary", "Womenswear", "Heritage", "Geometrics"]

title: W.21.EAS
description: Interval of Silence is an emotive woven textiles project based upon monuments & memorial located within the National Memorial Arboretum, Staffordshire. The Arboretum is a centre of Remembrance, run by a charity & dedicated to those who lost their lives, through duty or acts of terrorism since WW2.

title: W.21.ED
description: Celestial vaulting is a woven textiles collection inspired by mankind's fascination with the night sky & its insinuation of the heavens. Intended for use in the context of women's ready to wear fashion enveloping women in visions of the night sky & transcending their immediate surroundings.

title: W.21.GA
description: Draws inspiration from the environment in order to produce collections with a particular focus on sustainability. Experimenting with the use of renewable natural yarns, chemical-free dyes & organic textures in order to produce sustainable fabric for fashion. Use of natural colours to shift industry towards setting more eco-conscious trends.

title: W.21.HPB
description: Craftisan Florals' concept draws inspiration from the 19th century Arts & Crafts ideals, where designs for the applied arts were meticulously crafted. Garden florals provide the inspiration for patterns & colours then applying own style on a modern interpretation to these principles resulting in contemporary designs.

title: W.21.ICAI
description: Inspired by original photography based on flower petals frozen in Ice, collection Transience aims to capture a particular moment in time that is otherwise short-lived due to the decomposing nature of these natural materials. Collection presents fabrics of different weights to provide a cohesive look throughout a room setting.

title: W.21.JM
description: Memorise aims to evoke a feeling of nostalgia, remind people of calming & relaxing memories. Through natural elements from the seashore & symbolic flowers, designer brings nostalgia & calmness to space. Love for the natural world with her philosophy of simplicity, minimalism & quality to create bespoke fabrics.

title: W.21.KG
description: Polar Night is a collection created in response to the Covid-19 pandemic & how this has altered the way we inhabit our homes. In particular designer chose to focus on coping mechanisms to survive a harsh winter lockdown & how we adopted the methods of Scandinavian culture to cope with the long, dark days indoors.

title: W.21.LS
description: Feminine Phantasia', is a feminist drive collection of bespoke luxury fabrics appropriate for womenswear fashion. Fuelled by designer passion for classical literature, this collection is inspired by the mystical descriptions found in Ovid's 'Metamorphoses'; an epic poem of ancient myths which are all interconnected.

title: W.21.ML
description: Collection designed for a bereavement getaway to create a peaceful & relaxing environment to help with the healing process. Inspired by the beauty & charm of Britain's Harbours & the natural appeal of the spectacular coastlines.

title: W.21.NJ
description: The eventual disappearance of coal mining in the South Wales Valleys during the 1990's has caused an economic decline due to the loss of jobs within the mining sector. Designer hopes the Welsh Valleys can be regenerated through the use of staycation homes & intends through her collection portray the scenery of Pontycymer.
keywords: ["Into the Valleys", "Pontycymer, South Wales Valleys", "Sustainability", "Interior", "Wellness", "Abstracted Forms"]

title: W.21.NM
description: Bloom has tied together designer passions into one project as it is a sustainable collection designed for a wellbeing centre environment. The main samples are intended for room dividers to soften the acoustics of a room which will create a calming environment alongside a soothing colour palette.

title: W.21.RH
description: Spiritual Opulence' is a home interior collection made to focus on community & wellbeing. Inspired by seeing different communities working together throughout the pandemic, providing help & support to those vulnerable without preconceptions. Influenced by the mosaic tiles insides the mosques & churches.
keywords: ["Spiritual Opulence", "Islamic & Churches Architectural Mosaic Tiles, UK", "Contemporary", "Interior", "Wellness", "Geometrics"]

title: W.21.SR
description: The natural movement & reflections that are created by reeds & plants encased by water have visually inspired this project. This Water-land area captures a sense of natural harmony with the constant movement & interaction of the water & plants. Sensory project focuses on touch & how different textures can be handwoven.

title: W.21.YS
description: Glitches Within' is an exploration of technological faults & floral imperfections. The inverted disjoined style is tailored for the interiors market. It is designed for a high-end bar/restaurant that has different rooms with different themes though-out.

title: MM.24.JMB
description: Aims of this collection is to help raise awareness of ADHD symptom's in undiagnosed females in the general population & to encourage others to start wider conversation with friends, family & colleagues. To consider seeking professional help if they feel that they might have ADHD. Created a 3-D installation & Immersive Collection.
